  3951                                  ; Retro DOS v2.0 (24/02/2018)
  3952                                  ; [REF: MSDOS 3.3, MSBIO, "MSINIT.ASM"  (24/07/1987)]
  3953                                  
  3954                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3955                                  ;									:
  3956                                  ;	System initialization						:
  3957                                  ;									:
  3958                                  ;	The entry conditions are established by the bootstrap		:
  3959                                  ;	loader and are considered unknown. The following jobs		:
  3960                                  ;	will be performed by this module:				:
  3961                                  ;									:
  3962                                  ;	1.	All device initialization is performed			:
  3963                                  ;	2.	A local stack is set up and DS:SI are set		:
  3964                                  ;		to point to an initialization table. Then		:
  3965                                  ;		an inter-segment call is made to the first		:
  3966                                  ;		byte of the dos 					:
  3967                                  ;	3.	Once the dos returns from this call the ds		:
  3968                                  ;		register has been set up to point to the start		:
  3969                                  ;		of free memory. The initialization will then		:
  3970                                  ;		load the command program into this area 		:
  3971                                  ;		beginning at 100 hex and transfer control to		:
  3972                                  ;		this program.						:
  3973                                  ;									:
  3974                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3975                                  		
  3976                                  		; 20/12/2022
  3977                                  		; ----------------------
  3978                                  		; Registers
  3979                                  		; ----------------------
  3980                                  		; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  3981                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  3982                                  		; DS = 0, ES = 0, SS = 0
  3983                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  3984                                  		; SP = 700h
  3985                                  		; ----------------------
  3986                                  		; CX = 0				
  3987                                  
  3988                                  ; 02/10/2022 - 20/12/2022
  3989                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3990                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  3991                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  3992                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  3993                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  3994                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 70h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  3995                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector and then MSLOAD sets this).
  3996                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3997                                  
  3998                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  3999                                  ;
  4000                                  ;;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4001                                  ;;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4002                                  ;;	data sector of the bios.
  4003                                  ;
  4004                                  ;		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4005                                  ;		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4006                                  
  4007                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4008                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4009                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4010                                  
  4011                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4012 0000165D FA                      		cli
  4013                                  
  4014 0000165E 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4015 0000165F 07                      		pop	es
  4016                                  		;push	cx
  4017                                  		;push	di
  4018                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4019 00001660 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4020                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4021                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4022                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4023 00001662 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4024                                  next_int_:		
  4025 00001665 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4026 00001666 AC                      		lodsb		
  4027                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4028 00001667 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4029 00001668 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4030 0000166A D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4031 0000166C 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4032 0000166E 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4033                                  					; saving address in di
  4034                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4035                                  		;stosw
  4036                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4037                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4038                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4039 00001670 A5                      		movsw
  4040 00001671 A5                      		movsw		
  4041                                  
  4042 00001672 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4043 00001674 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4044                                  		
  4045                                  		;pop	di
  4046                                  		;pop	cx
  4047                                  
  4048                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4049                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4050                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4051                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4052                                  
  4053                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4054                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4055                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4056                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4057                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4058                                  
  4059                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4060 00001676 C7064C00[4F07]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4061                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4062                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4063 0000167C 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4064                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4065 00001680 C7065400[FE07]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4066                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4067                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4068 00001686 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4069                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4070 0000168A C7066400[BE07]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4071                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4072                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4073 00001690 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4074                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4075                                  
  4076                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4077 00001694 0E                      		push	cs
  4078 00001695 1F                      		pop	ds
  4079                                  		
  4080 00001696 A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4081 00001699 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4082 0000169C A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4083 0000169F A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4084                                  					; ;
  4085 000016A2 FB                      		sti
  4086 000016A3 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4087                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4088                                  
  4089                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4090                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4091                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4092                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4093                                  ;
  4094                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4095                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4096                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4097                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4098                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4099                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4100                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4101                                  
  4102                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4103                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4104                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4105                                  ;
  4106                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4107                                  ; to do anything special.
  4108                                  ;
  4109                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4110                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4111                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4112                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4113                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4114                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4115                                  
  4116                                  		; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4117 000016A5 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  4118                                  
  4119                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4120 000016A7 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4121                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4122 000016A9 751F                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4123                                  
  4124                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4125                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4126                                  ;
  4127                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4128                                  ;
  4129                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4130                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4131                                  
  4132                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4133                                  		;push	ax
  4134                                  		;push	bx
  4135                                  		;push	cx
  4136 000016AB 52                      		push	dx
  4137                                  		;push	di
  4138 000016AC 06                      		push	es
  4139 000016AD B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4140 000016AF B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4141 000016B1 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4142                                  					; DL = drive number
  4143                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4144                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4145                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4146 000016B3 7202                    		jc	short _gdskp_error
  4147                                  		;;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4148                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4149                                  		; ds = cs
  4150                                  		;mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4151 000016B5 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  4152                                  _gdskp_error:	
  4153                                  		; 20/12/2022			
  4154 000016B7 07                      		pop	es
  4155                                  		;pop	di
  4156 000016B8 5A                      		pop	dx
  4157                                  		;pop	cx
  4158                                  		;pop	bx
  4159                                  		;pop	ax
  4160                                  		
  4161 000016B9 720F                    		jc	short normalfloppydrv
  4162                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4163                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4164                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4165                                  		; ds = cs
  4166                                  		;cmp	byte [flp_drvs], 0
  4167                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4168                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4169                                  		;;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4170                                  		;mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4171                                  		;;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4172                                  		;; 18/12/2022
  4173                                  		;dec	ax
  4174                                  		;jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4175                                  		
  4176                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4177 000016BB 08C9                    		or	cl, cl ; [flp_drvs]
  4178 000016BD 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv		
  4179 000016BF 49                      		dec	cx	
  4180 000016C0 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4181                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4182                                  
  4183                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4184                                  		;20/12/2022
  4185                                  		; ds = cs
  4186 000016C2 FEC1                    		inc	cl	; cl = 1
  4187 000016C4 880E[8F15]              		mov	[fakefloppydrv], cl ; 1
  4188                                  		;mov	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1		
  4189                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4190                                  					; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4191                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4192                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4193 000016C8 EB0A                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4194                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4195                                  
  4196                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4197                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4198                                  		;rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4199                                  		;rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4200 000016CA D0C1                    		rol	cl, 1
  4201 000016CC D0C1                    		rol	cl, 1
  4202                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4203                                  		;;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4204                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4205                                  		;and	al, 3
  4206                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4207 000016CE 80E103                  		and	cl, 3
  4208 000016D1 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4209                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4210 000016D3 41                      		inc	cx
  4211                                  		;inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4212                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4213                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4214                                  		; ds = cs
  4215 000016D4 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4216                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4217                                  notsingle:	
  4218                                  		; 20/12/2022			
  4219                                  		;inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4220                                  		;			; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4221                                  		;			; booted off hard file
  4222                                  		;mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4223                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4224 000016D8 FEC1                    		inc	cl	; cl >= 2
  4225                                  
  4226                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4227                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4228                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4229                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4230                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4231                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4232                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4233                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4234                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4235                                  
  4236                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4237                                  
  4238                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4239 000016DA 88C8                    		mov	al, cl	; 26/05/2019
  4240                                  
  4241 000016DC F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4242 000016DF 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4243 000016E1 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4244                                  gothrd:					
  4245                                  
  4246                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  4247                                  ;   ax = 0-based drive we booted from
  4248                                  ;   bios_l, bios_h set.
  4249                                  ;   cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4250                                  ;   ch = media byte
  4251                                  
  4252                                  ; Retro DOS 4.0 - 27/12/2018 
  4253                                  ;  (from Retro DOS v2.0 boot sector)
  4254                                  ;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4255                                  ;   dh = media byte
  4256                                  
  4257                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4258 000016E3 88F5                    		mov	ch, dh		; 01/07/2018
  4259                                  
  4260                                  		; cl = number of floppies
  4261                                  		; ch = media byte
  4262                                  
  4263                                  		; set up local stack
  4264                                  
  4265                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4266                                  		;xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4267                                  					; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4268                                  					; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4269                                  					; ch = media byte
  4270                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4271                                  		; es = ds = cs
  4272                                  		; ss = 0
  4273                                  		; sp = 700h
  4274                                  
  4275                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4276                                  		;cli
  4277                                  		;mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4278                                  		;mov	sp, 700h
  4279                                  		;sti
  4280                                  
  4281 000016E5 51                      		push	cx ; (***) 	; save number of floppies and media byte
  4282                                  		
  4283 000016E6 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4284 000016E8 50                      		push	ax ; (**)	; save boot drive number and media byte
  4285                                  		
  4286                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4287                                  
  4288 000016E9 B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4289 000016EB CD15                    		int	15h	; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4290 000016ED 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4291 000016EF 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4292 000016F2 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4293                                  
  4294                                  ;		; 20/12/2022
  4295                                  ;		; (Programmer's Guide to the AMIBIOS, page 268)
  4296                                  ;		; (https://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_15-c0.html)
  4297                                  ;
  4298                                  ;		INT 15h, ah = C0h - Return System Configuration Parameters (PS/2 only)
  4299                                  ;
  4300                                  ;		on return:
  4301                                  ;		CF = 0 if successful
  4302                                  ;		   = 1 if error
  4303                                  ;		AH = when CF set, 80h for PC & PCjr, 86h for XT
  4304                                  ;	     	    (BIOS after 11/8/82) and AT (BIOS after 1/10/84)
  4305                                  ;
  4306                                  ;		ES:BX = pointer to system descriptor table in ROM of the format:
  4307                                  ;
  4308                                  ;		Offset Size	     Description
  4309                                  ;
  4310                                  ;		  00   word   length of descriptor (8 minimum)
  4311                                  ;		  02   byte   model byte (same as F000:FFFE, not reliable)
  4312                                  ;		  03   byte   secondary model byte
  4313                                  ;		  04   byte   BIOS revision level (zero based)
  4314                                  ;		  05   byte   feature information, see below
  4315                                  ;		  06   dword  reserved
  4316                                  
  4317                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4318                                  		; ds = cs
  4319 000016F4 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_modelbyte]
  4320 000016F8 A2[3606]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4321                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  4322                                  					; get/save model byte
  4323 000016FB 268A4703                		mov	al, [es:bx+3]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte]
  4324 000016FF A2[3706]                		mov	[secondary_model_byte], al
  4325                                  		;mov	[cs:secondary_model_byte], al
  4326                                  					; get/save secondary model byte
  4327 00001702 EB0C                    		jmp	short turn_timer_on
  4328                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4329                                  
  4330                                  no_rom_system_conf:			
  4331 00001704 BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh
  4332 00001707 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
  4333                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4334 00001709 26A00E00                		mov	al, [es:0Eh]	; get model byte (from 0FFFFh:0Eh)
  4335 0000170D A2[3606]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4336                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al ; save model byte
  4337                                  turn_timer_on:				
  4338 00001710 B020                    		mov	al, 20h	; ' '   ; turn on the timer
  4339 00001712 E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.
  4340                                  					; AKPORT
  4341                                  
  4342                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications
  4343                                  ; chip installed at io address 50h and 52h. if we're running
  4344                                  ; on one of those, we must inhibit the normal aux port initialization
  4345                                  
  4346                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4347                                  		; ds = cs
  4348 00001714 803E[3606]00            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0
  4349                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0 ; next to last	byte in	rom bios
  4350 00001719 7510                    		jnz	short not_olivetti_m24 ; skip for all other machines
  4351                                  					; (except olivetti m24)
  4352 0000171B E466                    		in	al, 66h		; is 8530 installed?
  4353 0000171D A820                    		test	al, 20h
  4354 0000171F 740A                    		jz	short not_olivetti_m24 ; we're done if not
  4355 00001721 B00F                    		mov	al, 0Fh		; double check
  4356 00001723 E650                    		out	50h, al
  4357 00001725 E450                    		in	al, 50h
  4358 00001727 A801                    		test	al, 1		; this test was	copied from olivetti
  4359 00001729 7414                    		jz	short skip_aux_port_init ; take	this branch if 8530 installed
  4360                                  
  4361                                  not_olivetti_m24:
  4362 0000172B B003                    		mov	al, 3		; init com4
  4363 0000172D E83108                  		call	aux_init
  4364 00001730 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; init com3
  4365 00001732 E82C08                  		call	aux_init
  4366 00001735 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; init com2
  4367 00001737 E82708                  		call	aux_init
  4368 0000173A 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; init com1
  4369 0000173C E82208                  		call	aux_init
  4370                                  
  4371                                  skip_aux_port_init:			
  4372 0000173F B002                    		mov	al, 2		; init lpt3
  4373 00001741 E81508                  		call	print_init
  4374 00001744 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; init lpt2
  4375 00001746 E81008                  		call	print_init
  4376 00001749 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; init lpt1
  4377 0000174B E80B08                  		call	print_init
  4378

  4419                                  ;		; 20/12/2022

  4421                                  ;		Address Size	   Description	 (BIOS/DOS Data Area)
  4422                                  ;	
  4423                                  ;		50:00	byte	Print screen status byte
  4424                                  ;				 00 = PrtSc not active,
  4425                                  ;				 01 = PrtSc in progress

  4429                                  ;		50:05  10bytes	POST work area

  4431                                  ;		50:10	word	BASICs default DS value (DEF SEG)
  4432                                  ;		50:12	dword	Pointer to BASIC INT 1C interrupt handler
  4433                                  ;		50:16	dword	Pointer to BASIC INT 23 interrupt handler
  4434                                  ;		50:1A	dword	Pointer to BASIC INT 24 disk error handler
  4435                                  ;		50:20	word	DOS dynamic storage
  4436                                  ;		50:22  14bytes	DOS diskette initialization table (INT 1E)
  4437                                  ;		50:30	4bytes	MODE command
  4438                                  ;		70:00		I/O drivers from IO.SYS/IBMBIO.COM

  4696                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  4697                                  ; diskette drives:
  4698                                  ;
  4699                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  4700                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  4701                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  4702                                  ;
  4703                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  4704                                  ;
  4705                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  4706                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  4707                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  4708                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  4709

  4720                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  4721                                  
  4722                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  4723                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  4724                                  
  4725                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  4726                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  4727                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  4728                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  4729                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  4730                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  4731                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  4732                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  4733

  4737                                  					; di <-	first bds link

  4740 00001862 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; -1 ; set end of link

  4769                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  4773                                  ; if cmos is bad, it gives es,ax,bx,cx,dh,di=0. cy=0.
  4774                                  ; in this case, we are going to put bogus informations to bds table.
  4775                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when

  4778                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.

  5040                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5041                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5042                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5043                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5057                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5058                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5059                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5060                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5061                                  ;
  5062                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5063                                  ;
  5064                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5065                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5066                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5067                                  ;use to start with.
  5068                                  ;
  5069                                  ;secondly, "dynamic configuration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5070                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5071                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5072                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5073                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5074

  5079                                  ;   3.	 end of bdss	; end of bdss for hard disks

  5144                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5145                                  ;
  5146                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5147                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5148                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5149                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5150                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5151                                  ; off of it.
  5152                                  ;
  5153                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5154                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5155                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5156                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5157                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5158                                  
  5159                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5160                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5161                                  checkcompaqbug:
  5162                                  		; 20/12/2022
  5163                                  		; es = 0F000h
  5164                                  		;mov	ax, 0F000h	; point	to ROM BIOS
  5165                                  		;mov	es, ax
  5166                                  
  5167                                  		; 19/10/2022
  5168 00001A1D 26813EEAFF434F          		cmp	word [es:0FFEAh], 'CO'
  5169                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEAh, 'OC' ; look for COMPAQ
  5170 00001A24 754B                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5171 00001A26 26813EECFF4D50          		cmp	word [es:0FFECh], 'MP'
  5172                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFECh, 'PM'
  5173 00001A2D 7542                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5174 00001A2F 26813EEEFF4151          		cmp	word [es:0FFEEh], 'AQ'
  5175                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEEh, 'QA'
  5176 00001A36 7539                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5177                                  
  5178                                  ; We're running on a COMPAQ. Now look at the date code.
  5179                                  
  5180 00001A38 26A1FBFF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFFBh]	; get year
  5181 00001A3C 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5182 00001A3E 3D3638                  		cmp	ax, 3836h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5183                                  		;cmp	ax, '86'        ; 3836h
  5184                                  					; is it	86?
  5185 00001A41 772E                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch
  5186 00001A43 7218                    		jb	short do_compaq_patch
  5187 00001A45 26A1F5FF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFF5h]	; get month
  5188 00001A49 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5189 00001A4B 3D3830                  		cmp	ax, 3038h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5190                                  		;cmp	ax, '08'        ; 3038h
  5191                                  					; is it	08?
  5192 00001A4E 7721                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch
  5193 00001A50 720B                    		jb	short do_compaq_patch
  5194 00001A52 26A1F8FF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFF8h]	; get day
  5195 00001A56 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5196 00001A58 3D3430                  		cmp	ax, 3034h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5197                                  		;cmp	ax, '04'        ; 3034h
  5198                                  					; is it	04?

  5469                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5470                                  ;

  5472                                  
  5473                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5474                                  
  5475                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5476                                  ; module name: remap
  5477                                  ;
  5478                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5479                                  ;
  5480                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5481                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5482                                  ;
  5483                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5484                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5485                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5486                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5487                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5488                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5489                                  
  5490                                  ; input:       none
  5491                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5492                                  ; exit error:  none
  5493                                  ; called from: msinit
  5494                                  ;
  5495                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5496                                  ;	  found in the system
  5497                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5498                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5499                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5500                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5501                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5502                                  ;
  5503                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5504                                  
  5505                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5506                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5507                                  
  5508                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5509 00001AB3 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5510                                  
  5511                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5512                                  
  5513                                  drive_loop:				
  5514 00001AB8 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5515                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5516 00001ABC 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5517 00001ABE 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5518                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5519 00001AC0 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5520 00001AC3 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5521 00001AC5 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5522                                  
  5523                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5524                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5525                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5526                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5527                                  
  5528                                  fdrv_found:				
  5529 00001AC7 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5530                                  fdrv_loop:				
  5531 00001AC9 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5532 00001ACC 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5533                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5534                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5535                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5536 00001ACE 40                      		inc	ax
  5537 00001ACF 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ?
  5538 00001AD2 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk drives
  5539                                  
  5540                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5541                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  5542                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  5543                                  ; any more.
  5544                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5545                                  
  5546 00001AD4 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  5547                                  					; get first bds
  5548 00001AD9 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5549                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  5550 00001ADB 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  5551 00001AE0 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  5552                                  remap_loop1:				
  5553 00001AE3 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5554                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  5555 00001AE5 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5556 00001AE8 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  5557 00001AEA FECC                    		dec	ah		; count down extra floppies
  5558 00001AEC 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  5559                                  
  5560                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  5561                                  
  5562 00001AEE 2EA0[8615]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  5563 00001AF2 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  5564 00001AF4 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  5565 00001AF6 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  5566 00001AFB 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  5567                                  
  5568                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  5569                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  5570                                  
  5571 00001AFD 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  5572 00001AFF EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  5573                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5574                                  
  5575                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  5576                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  5577                                  
  5578                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  5579 00001B01 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  5580                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  5581 00001B06 2EA2[8615]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  5582 00001B0A FEC0                    		inc	al
  5583 00001B0C 1E                      		push	ds
  5584 00001B0D BF2D04                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  5585                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  5586 00001B10 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  5587 00001B12 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  5588                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  5589                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  5590 00001B15 1F                      		pop	ds
  5591                                  rmap_exit:				
  5592 00001B16 C3                      		retn
  5593                                  
  5594                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5595                                  
  5596                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5597                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  5598                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  5599                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  5600                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  5601                                  ;**************************************************
  5602                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  5603                                  ;
  5604                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  5605                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  5606                                  ;
  5607                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  5608                                  ;**************************************************
  5609                                  
  5610                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5611                                  bootbias equ 200h
  5612                                  
  5613                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  5614                                  		
  5615                                  		; 08/04/2018
  5616                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  5617                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  5618                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5619                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  5620                                  
  5621 00001B17 2EA1[8915]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  5622 00001B1B 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  5623                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5624 00001B1D BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  5625                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  5626                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  5627 00001B20 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5628 00001B23 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  5629 00001B25 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  5630 00001B28 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5631                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5632                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5633                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5634 00001B2A 7209                    		jb	short erret
  5635                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5636 00001B2C 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  5637                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  5638                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  5639 00001B33 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  5640                                  erret:					
  5641 00001B35 F9                      		stc
  5642                                  norm_ret:				
  5643 00001B36 C3                      		retn
  5644                                  
  5645                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5646                                  
  5647                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  5648                                  
  5649                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5650                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  5651                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  5652                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  5653                                  ;   determine version number
  5654                                  ;
  5655                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  5656                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  5657                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  5658                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  5659                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  5660                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  5661                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  5662                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5663                                  
  5664                                  sethard:	; proc near
  5665                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5666                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  5667 00001B37 57                      		push	di
  5668 00001B38 53                      		push	bx
  5669                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  5670 00001B39 06                      		push	es
  5671 00001B3A 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5672 00001B3D 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5673 00001B40 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  5674                                  					; fnon_removable
  5675 00001B44 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  5676                                  					; ffHardFile
  5677 00001B48 C606[8815]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  5678 00001B4D 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  5679 00001B4F 52                      		push	dx
  5680 00001B50 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5681 00001B52 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5682                                  					; DL = drive number
  5683                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5684                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5685                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5686 00001B54 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  5687 00001B56 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  5688 00001B59 5A                      		pop	dx
  5689 00001B5A 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  5690 00001B5C 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  5691 00001B5F 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  5692 00001B62 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  5693 00001B63 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  5694 00001B66 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  5695 00001B67 7256                    		jb	short setret
  5696 00001B69 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  5697                                  
  5698                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  5699                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  5700                                  
  5701                                  act_part:
  5702 00001B6C 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  5703 00001B71 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  5704 00001B73 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  5705 00001B77 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  5706 00001B79 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  5707 00001B7D 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  5708 00001B7F 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  5709 00001B83 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  5710                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  5711 00001B85 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  5712                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  5713 00001B87 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  5714 00001B89 FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  5715                                  no_act:					
  5716 00001B8B 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  5717 00001B8E 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  5718                                  					; last entry done?
  5719 00001B92 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  5720 00001B94 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  5721                                  					; restore original value of bx
  5722                                  
  5723                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  5724                                  
  5725                                  get_primary:
  5726 00001B97 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  5727 00001B9C 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  5728                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  5729 00001B9E 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  5730 00001BA2 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  5731 00001BA4 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  5732 00001BA8 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  5733 00001BAA 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  5734 00001BAE 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  5735                                  got_prim:
  5736 00001BB0 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  5737 00001BB2 740F                    		jz	short set2
  5738 00001BB4 FECE                    		dec	dh
  5739                                  not_prim:
  5740 00001BB6 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  5741 00001BB9 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  5742 00001BBD 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  5743                                  setret:					
  5744 00001BBF F9                      		stc			; error	return
  5745 00001BC0 E99A02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  5746                                  
  5747                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5748                                  
  5749                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  5750                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  5751                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  5752                                  ;
  5753                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  5754                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  5755                                  ;  without change.
  5756                                  ;
  5757                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  5758                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  5759                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  5760                                  
  5761                                  set2:		
  5762                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5763                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  5764 00001BC3 8816[8B15]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  5765                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  5766                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  5767 00001BC7 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  5768 00001BCB 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  5769                                  
  5770                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  5771                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  5772                                  
  5773 00001BCF 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  5774 00001BD2 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  5775 00001BD5 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  5776 00001BD9 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  5777 00001BDD 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  5778 00001BDF 800E[8815]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  5779                                  okdrive:
  5780 00001BE4 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  5781 00001BE8 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  5782                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  5783 00001BEB 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  5784 00001BEF 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  5785 00001BF2 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  5786 00001BF6 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  5787 00001BFA 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  5788 00001BFD 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  5789                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  5790 00001C00 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  5791 00001C03 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  5792 00001C05 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  5793 00001C08 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  5794                                  okdrive_1:
  5795 00001C0A 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  5796 00001C0D 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  5797 00001C10 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  5798                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  5799 00001C12 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  5800 00001C15 50                      		push	ax
  5801 00001C16 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  5802 00001C18 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  5803 00001C1A F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  5804                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  5805                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5806                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  5807                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  5808 00001C1C A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  5809 00001C1F 58                      		pop	ax
  5810 00001C20 F7F3                    		div	bx
  5811 00001C22 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  5812 00001C24 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  5813 00001C26 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  5814 00001C28 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  5815 00001C2B 50                      		push	ax
  5816 00001C2C 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  5817                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  5818 00001C2E A1[2105]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 12/08/2023
  5819 00001C31 F7F3                    		div	bx
  5820                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  5821 00001C33 A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 12/08/2023
  5822 00001C36 58                      		pop	ax
  5823 00001C37 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  5824                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  5825 00001C39 833E[2105]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  5826                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  5827 00001C3E 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  5828 00001C40 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  5829 00001C43 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  5830                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  5831                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  5832                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  5833                                  okdrive_2:
  5834                                   		; 28/07/2019
  5835                                  ; dl is head.
  5836                                  ; ax is cylinder
  5837                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  5838                                  
  5839                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  5840                                  
  5841 00001C45 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  5842                                  					; check for mini disk
  5843 00001C49 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  5844 00001C4B 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  5845                                  					; set the physical track number
  5846                                  oknotmini:
  5847                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  5848                                  				
  5849 00001C4E D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  5850 00001C50 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  5851 00001C52 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  5852 00001C55 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  5853 00001C57 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch is cylinder (low 8 bits)
  5854                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  5855 00001C59 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is head
  5856                                  		
  5857                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  5858 00001C5B 8A16[8B15]              		mov	dl, [rom_drv_num]
  5859                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  5860                                  
  5861                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  5862                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  5863                                  ; dh is head
  5864                                  ; dl is drive
  5865                                  
  5866                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  5867                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  5868                                  
  5869                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  5870                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  5871                                  
  5872 00001C5F 0E                      		push	cs
  5873 00001C60 07                      		pop	es
  5874 00001C61 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  5875                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  5876                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  5877 00001C64 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5878 00001C67 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5879                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5880                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5881                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5882                                  
  5883                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  5884                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  5885                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  5886                                  
  5887                                  		; 11/08/2023
  5888                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  5889                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  5890 00001C69 53                      		push	bx
  5891 00001C6A 50                      		push	ax
  5892                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5893                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  5894 00001C6B 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  5895                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  5896 00001C6E 740B                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  5897 00001C70 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  5898                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  5899 00001C73 7525                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  5900 00001C75 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  5901                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  5902 00001C79 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  5903                                  check_1_ok:
  5904                                  		; 11/08/2023
  5905 00001C7B BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB ; disksector+11
  5906                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  5907                                  					; point to the bpb in the boot record
  5908                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  5909 00001C7E 8A470A                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 12/08/2023 
  5910                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  5911 00001C81 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  5912 00001C83 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  5913 00001C85 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  5914                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  5915 00001C87 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 12/08/2023
  5916 00001C8B 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  5917                                  
  5918                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  5919 00001C8D 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 12/08/2023
  5920                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  5921                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  5922                                  					; a power of 2
  5923                                  					;
  5924                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  5925                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  5926 00001C90 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it zero?
  5927 00001C92 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  5928                                  
  5929                                  ck_power_of_two:
  5930 00001C94 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift until first bit emerges
  5931 00001C96 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  5932 00001C98 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  5933                                  
  5934                                  invalid_boot_record:
  5935 00001C9A 58                      		pop	ax
  5936 00001C9B 5B                      		pop	bx
  5937 00001C9C E90901                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  5938                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  5939                                  
  5940                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5941                                  	; 12/08/2023
  5942                                  setret_brdg:
  5943 00001C9F E91DFF                  		jmp	setret
  5944                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5945                                  
  5946                                  unknown3_0_j:
  5947 00001CA2 E90701                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  5948                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  5949                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5950                                  
  5951                                  valid_boot_record:
  5952 00001CA5 58                      		pop	ax
  5953 00001CA6 5B                      		pop	bx
  5954                                  
  5955                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  5956                                  
  5957                                  		; 14/08/2023
  5958 00001CA7 817F08322E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '2.'
  5959                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5960                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E32h ; '2.'
  5961 00001CAC 7506                    		jnz	short try5
  5962 00001CAE 807F0A30                		cmp	byte [bx+10], '0'
  5963                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+0Ah], '0' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5964                                  		;;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 30h ; '0'
  5965                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5966                                  		;jnz	short try5
  5967                                  		;jmp	short copybpb
  5968 00001CB2 7425                    		jz	short copybpb
  5969                                  
  5970                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5971                                  ;	; 12/08/2023
  5972                                  ;setret_brdg:
  5973                                  ;		jmp	setret
  5974                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5975                                  ;
  5976                                  ;unknown3_0_j:
  5977                                  ;		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  5978                                  ;					; although, content might be bad.
  5979                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5980                                  
  5981                                  try5:
  5982 00001CB4 E8AA01                  		call	cover_fdisk_bug
  5983                                  
  5984                                  ; see if it is an os2 signature
  5985                                  
  5986                                  		; 12/08/2023
  5987                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment
  5988 00001CB7 817F08302E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '0.'
  5989                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '0.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5990                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E30h ; '0.'
  5991 00001CBC 750C                    		jnz	short no_os2
  5992 00001CBE 8A4707                  		mov	al, [bx+7] ; 12/08/2023
  5993                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+7]	; 17/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5994 00001CC1 2C31                    		sub	al, '1'
  5995                                  		;sub	al, 31h		; '1'
  5996 00001CC3 24FE                    		and	al, 0FEh
  5997 00001CC5 7412                    		jz	short copybpb	; accept either	'1' or '2'
  5998 00001CC7 E9DE00                  		jmp	unknown
  5999                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6000                                  
  6001                                  ; no os2 signature, this is to check for real dos versions
  6002                                  
  6003                                  no_os2:
  6004                                  		; 12/08/2023

  6400                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6401                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)

  6446                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)

  6448                                  		;   TmpVal2 = TmpVal2 / 2;
  6449                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6450                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  6451                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {
  6452                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = 0;
  6453                                  		;   BPB_FATSz32 = FATSz;
  6454                                  		;} else {
  6455                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz);

  6457                                  		;}
