 12727                                  
 12728                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12729                                  
 12730                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12731                                  ;	BootIo
 12732                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12733                                  ;
 12734                                  ; function: read/write the boot record into boot sector.
 12735                                  ;
 12736                                  ; input :
 12737                                  ;	    al=logical drive number
 12738                                  ;	    rFlag = operation (read/write)
 12739                                  ;
 12740                                  ; output:   for read operation,the boot record of the drive specified in bds
 12741                                  ;	    be read into the DiskSector buffer.
 12742                                  ;	    for write operation,the DiskSector buffer image will be written
 12743                                  ;	    to the drive specified in bds.
 12744                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 12745                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 12746                                  ;	    AX,CX,DX register destroyed.
 12747                                  ;	    if carry set,then al will contain the error code from DiskIO.
 12748                                  ;
 12749                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 12750                                  ;	DiskIO:NEAR
 12751                                  ;
 12752                                  ; logic:
 12753                                  ;
 12754                                  ; {
 12755                                  ;	first_sector = 0;	 /*logical sector 0 is the boot sector */
 12756                                  ;	sectorcount = 1;	 /*read 1 sector only */
 12757                                  ;	buffer = DiskSector;	 /*read it into the DiskSector buffer */
 12758                                  ;	call DiskIO (rFlag,drive_number,first_sector,sectorcount,buffer);
 12759                                  ; }
 12760                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12761                                  
 12762                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12763                                  BootIo:	
 12764 0000126F 06                      		push	es
 12765 00001270 57                      		push	di
 12766 00001271 53                      		push	bx
 12767 00001272 1E                      		push	ds
 12768 00001273 07                      		pop	es		; Point ES: to Bios_Data
 12769                                  
 12770                                  		; Call DiskIO to read/write the boot sec. The parameters which
 12771                                  		; need to be initialized for this subroutine out here are
 12772                                  		; - Transfer address to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 12773                                  		; - Low sector needs to be initalized to 0. this is a reg. param
 12774                                  		; - Hi sector in [Start_Sec_H] needs to be initialised to 0.
 12775                                  		; - Number of sectors <-- 1
 12776                                  
 12777 00001274 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; es:di -> transfer address
 12778 00001277 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; First	sector (h) -> 0
 12779 00001279 8916[2305]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx ; Start sector (h) -> 0
 12780 0000127D B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
 12781 00001280 E8E0F6                  		call	diskio
 12782 00001283 5B                      		pop	bx
 12783 00001284 5F                      		pop	di
 12784 00001285 07                      		pop	es
 12785 00001286 C3                      		retn
 12786                                  
 12787                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12788                                  
 12789                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12790                                  
 12791                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12792                                  ;	ChangeLineChk
 12793                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12794                                  ;
 12795                                  ; when the user calls get/set media id call before dos establishes the media
 12796                                  ; by calling "media_chk",the change line activity of the drive is going to be
 12797                                  ; lost.	this routine will check the change line activity and will save the
 12798                                  ; history in the flags.
 12799                                  ;
 12800                                  ; FUNCTION: check the change line error activity
 12801                                  ;
 12802                                  ; INPUT :  ES:di -> bds table.
 12803                                  ;
 12804                                  ; OUTPUT:   flag in bds table will be updated if change line occurs.
 12805                                  ;
 12806                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 12807                                  ;	Set_Changed_DL
 12808                                  ;
 12809                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12810                                  
 12811                                  ChangeLineChk:	
 12812 00001287 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12813 0000128B 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; Fixed	disk?
 12814 0000128D 7821                    		js	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Yes, skip it.
 12815                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12816 0000128F 26F6452304              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 4
 12817                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 4 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12818                                  					; return_fake_bpb
 12819 00001294 751A                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12820 00001296 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1	; This rom support change line?
 12821 0000129B 7513                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12822 0000129D E8EB06                  		call	haschange	; This drive support change line?
 12823 000012A0 740E                    		jz	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Do nothing
 12824                                  
 12825                                  		; Execute the rom disk interrupt to check changeline activity.
 12826                                  
 12827 000012A2 B416                    		mov	ah, 16h
 12828 000012A4 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - FLOPPY	DISK - CHANGE OF DISK STATUS (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
 12829                                  					; DL = drive to	check
 12830                                  					; Return: AH = disk change status
 12831 000012A6 7308                    		jnb	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12832 000012A8 53                      		push	bx
 12833 000012A9 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 12834                                  					; Update flag in BDS for this
 12835                                  					; physical drive
 12836 000012AC E8B506                  		call	set_changed_dl
 12837 000012AF 5B                      		pop	bx
 12838                                  ChangeLnChkRet:				
 12839 000012B0 C3                      		retn
 12840                                  
 12841                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12842                                  
 12843                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12844                                  
 12845                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12846                                  ;	GetAccessFlag
 12847                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12848                                  ;
 12849                                  ; FUNCTION: get the status of UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 12850                                  ;
 12851                                  ; INPUT :
 12852                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 12853                                  ;
 12854                                  ; OUTPUT:   a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 if disk i/o not allowed.
 12855                                  ;						 = 1 if disk i/o allowed.
 12856                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12857                                  
 12858                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12859                                  GetAccessFlag:				
 12860 000012B1 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 12861 000012B5 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12862                                  		;mov	al, 0		; Assume result	is unformatted
 12863                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12864 000012B8 28C0                    		sub	al, al
 12865                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12866 000012BA 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 12867                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12868                                  					; unformatted_media
 12869 000012BF 7502                    		jnz	short GafDone	; Done if unformatted
 12870 000012C1 FEC0                    		inc	al		; Return true for formatted
 12871                                  
 12872                                  GafDone:				
 12873 000012C3 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 12874 000012C6 C3                      		retn
 12875                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12876                                  
 12877                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12878                                  
 12879                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12880                                  ;	SetAccessFlag
 12881                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12882                                  ;
 12883                                  ; function: set/reset the UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 12884                                  ;
 12885                                  ; input :
 12886                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 12887                                  ;
 12888                                  ; output:   unformtted_media bit modified according to the user request
 12889                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12890                                  
 12891                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12892                                  SetAccessFlag:				
 12893 000012C7 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	points to request header
 12894 000012CB C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12895                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12896 000012CE 26806524FD              		and	byte [es:di+36], 0FDh
 12897                                  		;and	word [es:di+35], 0FDFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12898                                  					; ~unformatted_media
 12899 000012D3 807F0100                		cmp	byte [bx+1], 0	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 12900 000012D7 7505                    		jnz	short saf_Done
 12901                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12902 000012D9 26804D2402              		or	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 12903                                  		;or	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12904                                  					; unformatted_media
 12905                                  saf_Done:				
 12906 000012DE C3                      		retn
 12907                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12908                                  
 12909                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12910                                  
 12911                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12912                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 12913                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12914                                  ;
 12915                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 12916                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 12917                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 12918                                  ;
 12919                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12920                                  
 12921                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12922                                  ioctl_support_query:
 12923 000012DF 06                      		push	es
 12924 000012E0 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 12925 000012E4 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 12926                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 12927                                  
 12928                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 12929                                  		;cmp	al, 48h		; IOC_NEW_DC (PCDOS 7.1)
 12930                                  		;			; new generic ioctl function (FAT32)
 12931                                  		;jz	short ioctl_support
 12932                                  
 12933 000012E8 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 12934                                  					; See if major code is 8
 12935 000012EA 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 12936                                  ioctl_support:
 12937 000012EC 0E                      		push	cs
 12938 000012ED 07                      		pop	es
 12939                                  		; 02/09/2023
 12940                                  		;mov	cx, 14          ; (PCDOS 7.1) IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 12941 000012EE B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 12942                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12943 000012F1 BF[D20C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 12944                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 12945                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 12946 000012F4 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 12947 000012F6 F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 12948 000012F8 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 12949 000012FA B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 12950                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12951                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 12952                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 12953                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 12954                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 12955                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12956                                  ioctlsupexit:
 12957 000012FD 07                      		pop	es
 12958                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12959                                  		; cf = 0
 12960                                  		;clc
 12961 000012FE C3                      		retn
 12962                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12963                                  nosupport:
 12964 000012FF 07                      		pop	es
 12965 00001300 E9D2ED                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 12966                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12967                                  
 12968                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12969                                  
 12970                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12971                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 12972                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12973                                  ;
 12974                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 12975                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 12976                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 12977                                  ;	    drive)
 12978                                  ;
 12979                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 12980                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 12981                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 12982                                  ;
 12983                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 12984                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 12985                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 12986                                  ;
 12987                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 12988                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 12989                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 12990                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 12991                                  ;
 12992                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 12993                                  ;
 12994                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 12995                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 12996                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 12997                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 12998                                  ; 
 12999                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13000                                  
 13001                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13002                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13003 00001303 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13004 00001307 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13005                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13006                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13007 0000130A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13008 0000130C 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13009                                  		;
 13010 0000130E 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13011                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13012                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13013                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13014 00001312 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13015                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13016 00001314 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13017 00001316 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13018 00001318 FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13019                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13020 0000131A FEC8                    		dec	al
 13021 0000131C 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13022 0000131E 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13023 00001320 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13024 00001322 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13025 00001324 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13026 00001326 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13027 00001328 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13028                                  GotMediaType:				
 13029 0000132A 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13030                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13031                                  		; cf = 0
 13032                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13033 0000132D C3                      		retn
 13034                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13035                                  
 13036                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13037 0000132E 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13038 00001331 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13039 00001333 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13040 00001335 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13041 00001338 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13042                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13043 0000133A B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13044                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13045 0000133C B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13046 0000133E F9                      		stc
 13047 0000133F C3                      		retn
 13048                                  
 13049                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13050                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13051                                  		;db    0
 13052                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13053                                  
 13054                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13055                                  
 13056                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13057                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13058                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13059                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13060                                  
 13061                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13062                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13063                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13064                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13065                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13066                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13067                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13068                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13069                                  ;
 13070                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13071                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13072                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13073                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13074                                  ;
 13075                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13076                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13077                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13078                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13079                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13080                                  ;
 13081                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13082                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13083                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13084                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13085                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13086                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13087                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13088                                  
 13089                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13090                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13091                                  
 13092                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13093                                  
 13094                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13095 00001340 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13096 00001343 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13097 00001345 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13098 00001348 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13099                                  
 13100                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13101                                  
 13102 0000134A 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13103 0000134D 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13104 0000134F 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13105 00001352 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13106 00001354 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13107                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13108                                  
 13109                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13110 00001357 CF                      		iret
 13111                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13112                                  
 13113                                  int2f_replace_int13:
 13114 00001358 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13115 00001359 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13116                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13117                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13118                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13119 0000135B 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13120                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13121                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13122                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13123                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13124                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13125                                  		
 13126                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13127                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13128 00001360 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13129                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13130 00001364 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13131                                  
 13132                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13133                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13134                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13135                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13136                                  		
 13137                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13138                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13139 00001368 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13140 0000136C A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13141                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13142                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13143 0000136F 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13144 00001373 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13145                                  
 13146 00001377 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13147                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13148                                  		;pop	bx
 13149 00001378 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13150                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13151 00001379 58                      		pop	ax
 13152                                  i2f_iret:
 13153 0000137A CF                      		iret
 13154                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13155                                  
 13156                                  mine:
 13157 0000137B 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions
 13158 0000137D 73FB                    		jnb	short i2f_iret
 13159 0000137F 08C0                    		or	al, al			; a get installed state request?
 13160 00001381 7503                    		jnz	short disp_func
 13161 00001383 B0FF                    		mov	al, 0FFh
 13162                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13163                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13164 00001385 CF                      		iret
 13165                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13166                                  
 13167                                  disp_func:
 13168 00001386 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1			; request for installing bds?
 13169 00001388 7418                    		jz	short do_subfun_01
 13170 0000138A 3C03                    		cmp	al, 3			; get bds vector?
 13171 0000138C 7423                    		jz	short do_get_bds_vector
 13172                                  
 13173                                  ; set up pointer to request packet
 13174                                  
 13175 0000138E 1E                      		push	ds
 13176 0000138F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022	
 13177                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13178                                  					; = [0070h:25A0h] = [02C7h:0030h]
 13179                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13180                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav, bx
 13181                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav+2, es
 13182 00001394 891E[1200]              		mov	[ptrsav], bx
 13183 00001398 8C06[1400]              		mov	[ptrsav+2], es
 13184 0000139C 1F                      		pop	ds
 13185                                  		;jmp	far ptr	i2f_dskentry
 13186                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 13187                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1708h
 13188 0000139D EA[1907]7000            		jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry ; BIOSDATA:dsk_entry
 13189                                  		;; 17/10/2022
 13190                                  		;;jmp	far DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry
 13191                                  		; 20/09/2023
 13192                                  		;jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:i2f_dskentry ; 70h:i2f_dskentry
 13193                                  					; NOTE: jump to a FAR function, not an
 13194                                  					;  IRET type function. Callers of
 13195                                  					;  this int2f subfunction will have
 13196                                  					;  to be careful to do a popf
 13197                                  
 13198                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13199                                  
 13200                                  do_subfun_01:
 13201 000013A2 06                      		push	es
 13202 000013A3 1E                      		push	ds
 13203 000013A4 1E                      		push	ds
 13204 000013A5 07                      		pop	es
 13205                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13206 000013A6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]	
 13207                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13208                                  					; point	ds: -> Bios_Data
 13209 000013AB E8BC03                  		call	install_bds
 13210 000013AE 1F                      		pop	ds
 13211 000013AF 07                      		pop	es
 13212                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13213                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13214 000013B0 CF                      		iret
 13215                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13216                                  
 13217                                  do_get_bds_vector:
 13218                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13219 000013B1 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]			
 13220                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13221 000013B6 C53E[1901]              		lds	di, [start_bds]
 13222                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds
 13223                                  ;ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13224                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13225                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13226 000013BA CF                      		iret
 13227                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13228                                  
 13229                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13230                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13231                                  
 13232                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13233                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13234                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 13235                                  
 13236                                  win386call:				
 13237 000013BB 1E                      		push	ds
 13238 000013BC 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13239                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13240                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 13241 000013C1 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 13242                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 13243 000013C3 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 13244 000013C5 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 13245                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 13246 000013C7 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 13247                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13248 000013C9 F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13249                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13250 000013CC 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13251                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 13252 000013CE 8026[6F08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 13253 000013D3 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 13254                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13255                                  
 13256                                  Win386Init:
 13257                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13258 000013D5 F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13259                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13260 000013D8 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13261                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 13262 000013DA 800E[6F08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 13263                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 13264                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 13265 000013DF 891E[3D08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx

 13267                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI

 13270 000013EB 07                      		pop	es
 13271                                  win_iret:
 13272 000013EC 1F                      		pop	ds
 13273                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13274                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 13275                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13276 000013ED CF                      		iret
 13277                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13278                                  
 13279                                  handle_multmult:
 13280 000013EE 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 13281 000013F0 7514                    		jnz	short try_2
 13282 000013F2 1E                      		push	ds
 13283 000013F3 E84500                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13284                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13285                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 13286                                  		;dec	bx
 13287 000013F6 BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 13288 000013F9 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 13289 000013FB 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13290 000013FD F7D3                    		not	bx
 13291 000013FF 09DB                    		or	bx, bx

 13293 00001403 43                      		inc	bx
 13294                                  try_1:
 13295 00001404 1F                      		pop	ds

 13298 00001405 CF                      		iret

 13300                                  
 13301                                  try_2:
 13302 00001406 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13303 00001408 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13304 0000140A 1E                      		push	ds
 13305                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13306                                  		;xor	di, di
 13307                                  		;dec	di

 13309 0000140E 8EC7                    		mov	es, di

 13314 0000141A 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13315 0000141C 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13316                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13317                                  		;sub	di, di
 13318                                  		;dec	di

 13320                                  		;jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13321                                  		; 02/09/2023

 13330                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h

 13353                                  
 13354                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13355                                  
 13356                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13357                                  ;
 13358                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13359                                  ;
 13360                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13361                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13362                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13363                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13364                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13365                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13366                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13367                                  ;
 13368                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13369                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13370                                  ;
 13371                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13372                                  
 13373                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13374                                  HMAPtr:
 13375 0000143B 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13376                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13377 00001440 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13378                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13379 00001444 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13380 00001447 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13381 00001449 803E[9C08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13382                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13383 0000144E 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13384 00001450 FF1E[9808]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13385                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13386 00001454 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13387                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13388                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13389 00001458 C3                      		retn
 13390                                  
 13391                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13392                                  
 13393                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13394                                  
 13395                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13396                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13397                                  
 13398                                  move_sector:
 13399                                  
 13400                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13401                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13402                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13403                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13404                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13405                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13406                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13407                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13408                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13409                                  ;
 13410                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13411                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13412                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13413                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13414                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13415                                  
 13416 00001459 FC                      		cld
 13417 0000145A 51                      		push	cx
 13418 0000145B B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13419 0000145E 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13420 00001462 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13421 00001464 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13422 00001468 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13423 0000146A F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13424 0000146C 59                      		pop	cx
 13425 0000146D C3                      		retn
 13426                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13427                                  
 13428                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13429 0000146E D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13430 00001470 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13431 00001472 59                      		pop	cx
 13432 00001473 C3                      		retn
 13433                                  
 13434                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13435                                  
 13436                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13437                                  
 13438                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13439                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13440                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13441                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13442                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13443                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13444                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13445                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13446                                  ;
 13447                                  ; input conditions:
 13448                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13449                                  ;
 13450                                  ; output:
 13451                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13452                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13453                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13454                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13455                                  
 13456                                  check_wrap:	
 13457 00001474 50                      		push	ax
 13458 00001475 53                      		push	bx
 13459 00001476 06                      		push	es
 13460 00001477 57                      		push	di
 13461 00001478 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13462 0000147B 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13463                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13464 0000147D 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13465                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13466 00001482 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13467 00001484 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13468 00001488 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13469 0000148A 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13470 0000148D 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13471 0000148F 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13472 00001491 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13473                                  
 13474                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13475                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13476                                  
 13477 00001493 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13478 00001495 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13479                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13480 00001497 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13481 00001498 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13482                                  					; if on	boundary
 13483                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13484                                  not_on_bound:
 13485 0000149A 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13486 0000149D 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13487 0000149F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13488 000014A1 40                      		inc	ax
 13489 000014A2 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13490 000014A4 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13491                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13492 000014A7 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13493 000014AB 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13494                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13495                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13496 000014AD 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13497 000014AF 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13498 000014B0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13499                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13500 000014B2 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13501                                  
 13502                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13503                                  
 13504 000014B4 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13505 000014B6 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13506 000014B8 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13507                                  
 13508                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13509                                  
 13510 000014BA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13511 000014BC 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13512 000014BE 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13513                                  no_head_bound:				
 13514 000014BF 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13515 000014C1 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13516 000014C2 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13517 000014C4 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13518 000014C6 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13519 000014C8 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13520 000014CB B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13521 000014CD 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13522 000014CF D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13523 000014D1 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13524 000014D3 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13525 000014D5 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13526 000014D7 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13527 000014D9 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13528                                  no_wrap:				
 13529 000014DB F8                      		clc
 13530 000014DC 5F                      		pop	di
 13531 000014DD 07                      		pop	es
 13532 000014DE 5B                      		pop	bx
 13533 000014DF 58                      		pop	ax
 13534 000014E0 C3                      		retn
 13535                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13536                                  
 13537                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13538 000014E1 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13539 000014E3 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13540 000014E5 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13541                                  
 13542                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13543                                  
 13544                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13545                                  
 13546                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13547                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13548                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13549                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13550                                  ;
 13551                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13552                                  
 13553                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13554                                  find_bds:	
 13555 000014E7 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13556                                  fbds_1:					
 13557 000014EB 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13558 000014EF 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13559 000014F1 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13560                                  					; go to next bds
 13561 000014F4 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13562 000014F7 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13563 000014F9 F9                      		stc
 13564                                  fdbs_2:					
 13565 000014FA C3                      		retn
 13566                                  
 13567                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13568                                  
 13569                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13570                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13571                                  doint:
 13572                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13573 000014FB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13574                                  					; get physical drive number
 13575                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13576                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13577                                  		
 13578 000014FE 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13579 00001500 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13580 00001502 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13581                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13582 00001504 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13583                                  					; get request code
 13584                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13585 00001507 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13586                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13587 0000150A 9D                      		popf
 13588                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13589                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13590 0000150B 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13591                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13592                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13593 00001510 9C                      		pushf
 13594                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13595 00001511 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13596                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13597                                  dointdone:				
 13598 00001514 C3                      		retn
 13599                                  
 13600                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13601                                  
 13602                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13603                                  
 13604                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13605                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13606                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13607                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13608                                  ;
 13609                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13610                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13611                                  ;
 13612                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13613                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13614                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13615                                  
 13616                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13617                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13618                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13619                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13620                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13621                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13622                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13623                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13624                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13625                                  ;end struc
 13626                                  
 13627                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13628                                  
 13629                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13630                                  ;	ah = function
 13631                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13632                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13633                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13634                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13635                                  ;   output conditions:
 13636                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13637                                  
 13638                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13639                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13640                                  ;
 13641                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13642                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13643                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13644                                  
 13645                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13646                                  
 13647                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13648                                  
 13649 00001515 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13650                                  
 13651                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13652                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13653                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13654                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13655                                  
 13656                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13657                                  
 13658                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13659                                  
 13660                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13661                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13662                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13663                                  
 13664                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13665 00001519 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13666 0000151E 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13667 00001520 53                      		push	bx
 13668 00001521 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13669 00001524 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13670 00001527 5B                      		pop	bx
 13671 00001528 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13672                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13673                                  
 13674                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13675                                  
 13676                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13677                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13678                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13679                                  
 13680                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13681                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13682 0000152A 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13683 0000152C 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13684 0000152E 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13685 0000152F 51                      		push	cx
 13686 00001530 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13687 00001532 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13688 00001534 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13689 00001536 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13690 0000153A 59                      		pop	cx
 13691 0000153B 58                      		pop	ax
 13692 0000153C 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13693                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13694 0000153E 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13695 0000153F 06                      		push	es
 13696                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13697 00001540 2EC41E[1515]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13698                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13699                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13700 00001545 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13701 00001547 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13702 0000154A 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13703                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13704                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13705 0000154E 07                      		pop	es
 13706 0000154F 5B                      		pop	bx
 13707 00001550 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13708                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13709                                  
 13710                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13711                                  
 13712                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13713                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13714                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13715                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13716                                  
 13717                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13718 00001552 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13719                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13720 00001557 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13721 00001559 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13722                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13723 0000155E 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13724                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13725 00001560 50                      		push	ax
 13726 00001561 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13727                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13728                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13729 00001563 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13730                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13731                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13732 00001568 58                      		pop	ax
 13733 00001569 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13734                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13735                                  
 13736                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13737                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13738                                  
 13739                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13740                                  
 13741                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13742                                  
 13743                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13744                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13745                                  
 13746                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13747 0000156B 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13748                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13749                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data

 13751                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13752                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13753                                  
 13754                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13755                                  
 13756 00001571 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13757 00001574 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat

 13759                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13760                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13761 00001579 803E[2905]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13762 0000157E 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13763                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13764                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13765                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13766 00001580 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13767                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13768                                  		
 13769 00001585 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13770

 13772                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13773 0000158B 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13774                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13775                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13776 0000158D 9D                      		popf
 13777 0000158E 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13778                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13779 00001590 1F                      		pop	ds
 13780 00001591 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13781                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13782                                  
 13783                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13784                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13785                                  ; a changeline error.
 13786                                  
 13787                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13788 00001594 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13789                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13790 00001596 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13791 00001599 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13792 0000159B 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13793 0000159D 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13794 0000159F 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13795 000015A4 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13796                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13797                                  					; never	would
