 19748                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19749                                  ;
 19750                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19751                                  ;
 19752                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19753                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19754                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19755                                  ;
 19756                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19757                                  ;
 19758                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19759                                  
 19760                                  AllocHMA:
 19761                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19762                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19763                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19764                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19765                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19766                                  
 19767                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19768                                  ;
 19769                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19770                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19771                                  ;	push	ax
 19772                                  ;	popf
 19773                                  ;	pushf
 19774                                  ;	pop	ax
 19775                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19776                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19777                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19778                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19779                                  
 19780                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19781                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19782                                  
 19783 00000A58 1E                      	push	ds
 19784                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19785                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19786                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19787 00000A59 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19788 00000A5C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19789                                  
 19790 00000A5E E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19791 00000A61 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19792                                  
 19793 00000A63 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19794 00000A66 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19795                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19796                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19797                                  
 19798 00000A68 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19799                                  	;mov	[0Eh],bx
 19800 00000A6C 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19801                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19802                                  
 19803 00000A70 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19804 00000A72 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19805                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19806 00000A75 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19807 00000A79 48                      	dec	ax
 19808 00000A7A 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19809                                  
 19810                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19811                                  
 19812 00000A7C B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19813 00000A7E CD15                    	int	15h
 19814                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19815                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19816                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19817 00000A80 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19818                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19819                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19820 00000A83 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19821                                  allocHMA_1:
 19822 00000A85 B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19823                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19824 00000A87 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]

 19918                                  
 19919                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19920                                  ;
 19921                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19922                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19923                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19924                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19925                                  ;
 19926                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19927                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19928                                  ;
 19929                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19930                                  
 19931                                  StartVDHead:
 19932                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19933                                  
 19934 00000AD0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19935 00000AD4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19936 00000AD6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19937 00000AD8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19938 00000ADA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19939                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19940 00000ADB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19941                                  VDiskSig1:
 19942 00000AE2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19943                                  
 19944                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19945                                  
 19946 00000AE7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19947                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19948 00000AED 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19949 00000AFC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19950 00000AFE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19951                                  VDInt19:
 19952 00000AFF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19953                                  OldVDInt19:
 19954 00000B00 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19955                                  
 19956                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19957                                  
 19958                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19959 00000B04 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19960                                  VDiskSig2:
 19961 00000B07 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19962                                  
 19963                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19964                                  
 19965 00000B0C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19966 00000B0F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19967 00000B11 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19968 00000B12 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19969 00000B14 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19970 00000B15 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19971 00000B17 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19972 00000B19 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19973 00000B1A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19974 00000B1C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19975 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19976 00000B20 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19977 00000B22 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19978                                  
 19979                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19980                                  
 19981                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19982                                  ;
 19983                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19984                                  ;
 19985                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19986                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19987                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19988                                  ;
 19989                                  ; Inputs : None
 19990                                  ;
 19991                                  ; Outputs : None
 19992                                  ;
 19993                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19994                                  ;
 19995                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19996                                  
 19997                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19998                                  
 19999                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20000 00000B24 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20001 00000B26 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20002                                  
 20003                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20004                                  
 20005                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20006 00000B28 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20007                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20008 00000B2B 2EA3[000B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20009 00000B2F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20010                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20011 00000B32 2EA3[020B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20012                                  
 20013                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20014                                  
 20015 00000B36 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20016                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20017                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20018 00000B38 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20019 00000B3B CD21                    	int	21h
 20020                                  
 20021                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20022                                  
 20023 00000B3D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20024 00000B3E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20025                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20026 00000B40 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20027                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20028 00000B47 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20029 00000B4E 40                      	inc	ax
 20030 00000B4F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20031                                  
 20032                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20033                                  
 20034 00000B51 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20035                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20036 00000B52 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20037 00000B58 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20038                                  
 20039                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20040                                  
 20041                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20042 00000B5B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20043 00000B5E BE[D00A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20044 00000B61 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20045 00000B63 0E                      	push	cs
 20046 00000B64 1F                      	pop	ds
 20047 00000B65 FC                      	cld
 20048 00000B66 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20049 00000B68 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20050                                  
 20051                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20052                                  
 20053                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20054 00000B69 57                      	push	di
 20055 00000B6A 06                      	push	es
 20056                                  
 20057                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20058                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20059                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20060 00000B6B 49                      	dec	cx
 20061                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20062 00000B6C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20063                                  
 20064 00000B6E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20065                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20066 00000B71 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20067 00000B74 BE[040B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20068 00000B77 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20069                                  
 20070 00000B79 5F                      	pop	di
 20071 00000B7A 07                      	pop	es
 20072                                  
 20073 00000B7B C3                      	retn
 20074                                  
 20075                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20076                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 20077                                  ;
 20078                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 20079                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 20080                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 20081                                  ;
 20082                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20083                                  
 20084                                  struc desc
 20085 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 20086 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 20087 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 20088 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 20089 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 20090                                   .size:

 20099 00000B84 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20100 00000B8C FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 20101 00000B8E 0000                    		dw	0

 20104 00000B92 0000                    		dw	0

 20106 00000B96 0000                    		dw	0

 20108 00000B99 93                      		db	93h

 20114 00000BA4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0

 20116 00000BAC 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 20117

 20119                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20120

 20122                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20123                                  
 20124                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20125                                  
 20126                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20127                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20128                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	     ;I070
 20129                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	     ;I070
 20130                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	     ;I070
 20131                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	     ;I070
 20132                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	     ;I070
 20133                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	     ;I070
 20134                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			     ;I070
 20135                                  ;								     ;I070
 20136                                  ;	in      al,64h         		; Test for passwd servr mode ;I070
 20137                                  ;	test    al,10h			; Is keyboard inhibited?     ;I070
 20138                                  ;	jnz     short ClrVDISKok	; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20139                                  ;					; Check for Tortugas...	     ;I070
 20140                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                	     ;I070
 20141                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h  ; ds = cs       
 20142                                  ;	mov	ax,[sys_model_byte]
 20143                                  ;	cmp	ax,19F8h
 20144                                  ;	je      short ClrVDISKno                            	     ;I070
 20145                                  ;					; Check for mod 30-286	     ;I070
 20146                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh			     ;I070
 20147                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],09FCh	
 20148                                  ;	cmp	ax,09FCh
 20149                                  ;	jne     short ClrVDISKok			      	     ;I070
 20150                                  ;ClrVDISKno:							     ;I070	
 20151                                  ;	retn	               		; Return w/o block move.     ;I070
 20152                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							     ;I070
 20153                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20154                                  
 20155                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20156                                  	; ds = cs
 20157                                  
 20158                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20159                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20160                                  
 20161 00000BCC 06                      	push	es
 20162 00000BCD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20163 00000BCF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20164 00000BD1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20165 00000BD3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20166 00000BD5 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20167 00000BD7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20168 00000BD9 05[AC0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20169 00000BDC 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20170                                  
 20171                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20172                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20173                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20174                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20175                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 20176                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20177                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20178 00000BDF A3[8E0B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 20179                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20180 00000BE2 8816[900B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20181                                  
 20182 00000BE6 B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 20183 00000BE9 0E                      	push	cs
 20184 00000BEA 07                      	pop	es
 20185 00000BEB BE[7C0B]                	mov	si,bmove
 20186 00000BEE B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 20187 00000BF0 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 20188                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 20189                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 20190                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 20191 00000BF2 07                      	pop	es

 20198                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.

 20200                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20201                                  ;		the offset.

 20215 00000BFC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 20216                                  	; 03/09/2023

 20218                                  	;

 20220 00000C04 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20221 00000C07 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20222 00000C0A B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20223 00000C0C D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20224 00000C0E 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20225                                  	;
 20226                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20227                                  	;push	ds
 20228                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20229                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h

 20233                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 20234 00000C10 893E[9608]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20235                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20236 00000C14 1F                      	pop	ds

 20242                                  ;
 20243                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary

 20264 00000C2B 740F                    	je	short ivdins_retn
 20265 00000C2D B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh

 20267                                  	;mov	si,10h+(VDiskSig2-VDiskHMAHead) ; 13h
 20268 00000C32 BE1300                  	mov	si,13h

 20279                                  ;
 20280                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20281                                  ;
 20282                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20283                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20284                                  ;
 20285                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20286                                  
 20287                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20288                                  CPMHack:
 20289 00000C3D 1E                      	push	ds
 20290 00000C3E B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20291 00000C41 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = 0FFFFh
 20292                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20293                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20294 00000C43 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20295 00000C44 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20296 00000C46 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20297 00000C49 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20298                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20299 00000C4C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20300 00000C4E FC                      	cld
 20301 00000C4F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20302 00000C51 1F                      	pop	ds
 20303 00000C52 C3                      	retn

 20318                                  ;**	TempCDS - Create (Temporary?) CDS
 20319                                  ;

 21204                                  
 21205                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21206                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21207                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21208                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21209                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21210                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21211                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21212                                  ;
 21213                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21214                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21215                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21216                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21217                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21218                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21219                                  ;
 21220                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21221                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21222                                  ;
 21223                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21224                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21225                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21226                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21227                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21228                                  ;
 21229                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21230                                  ;
 21231                                  ;			  none.
 21232                                  
 21233                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21234                                  ;
 21235                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21236                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21237                                  
 21238                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21239

 21445                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21446                                  ;
 21447                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21448                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21449                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21450                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21451                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21452                                  ; program).

 21455

 21457

 21463                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next

 21467                                  ; carridge return.

 21614                                  
 21615                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21616                                  ;
 21617                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21618                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21619                                  ;
 21620                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21621                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21622                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21623                                  
 21624                                  ParaRound:
 21625 0000114B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21626 0000114E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21627 00001150 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21628 00001152 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21629 00001154 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21630 00001156 C3                      	retn
 21631                                  
 21632                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21633                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21634                                  ;
 21635                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21636                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21637                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21638                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21639                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21640                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21641                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21642                                  ;
 21643                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21644                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21645                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21646                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21647                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21648                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21649                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset value of end of sysinit module label
 21650                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21651                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21652                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21653                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21654                                  ;
 21655                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21656                                  
 21657                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21658                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21659                                  sysinit_base:				
 21660 00001157 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21661 0000115C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21662 00001161 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21663 00001163 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21664 00001168 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21665 0000116D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21666 0000116E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21667 0000116F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21668                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21669                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21670 00001171 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21671 00001174 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21672 00001179 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21673                                  
 21674                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21675                                  
 21676 0000117B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21677 0000117D 0E                      	push	cs
 21678 0000117E 1F                      	pop	ds
 21679                                  	; 30/12/2022
 21680                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 21681                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 21682 0000117F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21683                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21684 00001182 CD21                    	int	21h
 21685                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21686                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21687                                  
 21688                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21689                                  stall:
 21690                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21691                                  _stall: 
 21692                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21693 00001184 F4                      	hlt 
 21694                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21695                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21696 00001185 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21697                                  
 21698                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21699 00001187 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21700                                  
 21701                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21702                                  
 21703                                  sum_up:
 21704                                  
 21705                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21706                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21707                                  ;
 21708                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21709                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21710                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21711                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21712                                  ;
 21713                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21714                                  
 21715 0000118C 1E                      	push	ds
 21716                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 21717                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 21718 0000118D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21719                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21720                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21721 00001191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21722 00001193 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21723 00001195 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21724 00001197 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21725                                  					; whole test better fail.
 21726 0000119C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21727 0000119E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21728                                  sum1:
 21729 000011A0 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21730 000011A2 46                      	inc	si
 21731 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 21732 000011A4 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21733                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21734                                  sum_sys_code:
 21735                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21736 000011A6 BEA611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21737                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21738                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21739                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21740                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21741                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21742                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21743                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 21744 000011A9 B9[704D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21745 000011AC 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21746 000011AE D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21747                                  sum2:
 21748 000011B0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21749 000011B3 46                      	inc	si
 21750 000011B4 46                      	inc	si
 21751 000011B5 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21752 000011B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 21753 000011B8 C3                      	retn
 21754                                  
 21755                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21756                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21757                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 21758                                  
 21759                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21760                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 21761 000011B9 0000                    	dw	0
 21762                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21763                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 21764 000011BB 0000                    	dw	0	
 21765                                  
 21766                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 21767                                  
 21768                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 21769                                  
 21770                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6:  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:12F6h
 21771 000011BD 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 21772 000011BF 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 21772 000011C8 6C6F636174696F6E20-
 21772 000011D1 6572726F722024     
 21773                                  
 21774                                  end_sysinit_base: ; label byte
 21775                                  	; 24/10/2022

 21777                                  
 21778                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21779                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21780                                  ;
 21781                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21782                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21783                                  ;
 21784                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21785                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21786                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21787                                  ;
 21788                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21789                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21790                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21791                                  
 21792                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21793                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21794                                  
 21795                                  set_buffer:
 21796 000011D8 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21797 000011DA E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21798 000011DD 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21799                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 21800                                  	; 17/09/2023
 21801 000011DF FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 21802                                  set_buff_1:
 21803                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21804                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21805 000011E1 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21806                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21807 000011E3 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21808                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21809 000011E6 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21810                                  
 21811 000011EB 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21812 000011ED 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21813 000011F2 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21814                                  
 21815                                  ;	for each buffer
 21816                                  
 21817                                  nxt_buff:
 21818 000011F3 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 21819 000011F6 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 21820 000011F8 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 21821                                  
 21822 000011FA 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 21823                                  
 21824 000011FF 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 21825                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21826 00001200 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21827 00001203 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21828                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21829                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21830 00001205 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 21831                                  
 21832 00001209 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 21833 0000120B 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21834                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21835 0000120D C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21836 00001211 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21837                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of scratch buff is 0
 21838 00001215 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21839                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21840 0000121A 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21841 0000121D 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21842                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21843                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 21844                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 21845 00001221 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21846                                  set_buff_2:
 21847 00001224 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 21848                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 21849 00001229 2E800E[BD14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 21850                                  	;call	round
 21851                                  	;retn
 21852                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21853 0000122F E93D30                  	jmp	round
 21854                                  
 21855                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21856                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21857                                  ;
 21858                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21859                                  ;
 21860                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21861                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21862                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21863                                  
 21864                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21865                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21866 00001232 53                      	push	bx
 21867 00001233 52                      	push	dx
 21868 00001234 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21869 00001238 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21870                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21871 0000123D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21872                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21873                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21874                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21875 00001240 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21876 00001242 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21877 00001244 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21878                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21879 00001247 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21880 00001249 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21881 0000124C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 21882                                  
 21883                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21884                                  	; 05/09/2023
 21885                                  	; zf=1
 21886 0000124E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 21887                                  	; zf=1
 21888                                  	
 21889                                  	;zf=1
 21890                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21891                                  	;zf=1
 21892 0000124F 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21893                                  got_hma:
 21894 00001254 5A                      	pop	dx
 21895 00001255 5B                      	pop	bx
 21896 00001256 C3                      	retn
 21897

 21899                                  
 21900                                  set_buffer_info:
 21901                                  
 21902                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 21903                                  ;
 21904                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 21905                                  ;    ax = di
 21906                                  ;
 21907                                  ;out:
 21908                                  ;    above entries set.
 21909                                  
 21910                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21911 00001257 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 21912                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 21913 0000125C 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21914 00001260 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21915 00001264 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; adjust ax
 21916                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21917 00001269 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 21918                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 21919 0000126C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 21920                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21921 00001272 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21922                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21923 00001278 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 21924 0000127E C3                      	retn
 21925                                  
 21926                                  ; ======================================================================
 21927                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21928                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21929                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21930                                  
 21931                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21932                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21933                                  ;
 21934                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21935                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21936                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21937                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21938                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21939                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21940                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21941                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21942                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21943                                  ;
 21944                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21945                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21946                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21947                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21948                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21949                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21950                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21951                                  ;	conditions:
 21952                                  ;
 21953                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21954                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21955                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21956                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21957                                  ;
 21958                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21959                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21960                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21961                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21962                                  ;
 21963                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21964                                  ;
 21965                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21966                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21967                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21968                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21969                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21970                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21971                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21972                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21973                                  ;
 21974                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21975                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21976                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21977                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21978                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement stack logic in this case.
 21979                                  ;
 21980                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21981                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21982                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21983                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21984                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21985                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21986                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21987                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21988                                  ;
 21989                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21990                                  
 21991                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21992                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21993                                  
 21994                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21995                                  stackinit:
 21996 0000127F 50                      	push	ax
 21997 00001280 1E                      	push	ds
 21998 00001281 06                      	push	es
 21999 00001282 53                      	push	bx
 22000 00001283 51                      	push	cx
 22001 00001284 52                      	push	dx
 22002 00001285 57                      	push	di
 22003 00001286 56                      	push	si
 22004 00001287 55                      	push	bp
 22005                                  
 22006                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22007                                  
 22008                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22009                                  	; ds = cs
 22010 00001288 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22011 0000128B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22012                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22013                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22014                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22015 0000128D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22016                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22017 00001291 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22018 00001294 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22019                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22020 00001298 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22021                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22022                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22023                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22024 0000129B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22025                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22026 0000129F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22027 000012A1 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22028                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22029                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22030                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22031 000012A4 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22032                                  
 22033                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22034                                  
 22035                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22036                                  
 22037                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22038                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22039                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22040 000012A8 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22041                                  
 22042                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22043                                  
 22044 000012AD B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22045                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22046                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22047                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22048 000012B0 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22049 000012B2 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22050 000012B4 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22051 000012B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22052 000012BA 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22053                                  
 22054                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22055                                  
 22056 000012BD 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22057 000012C2 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22058 000012C6 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22059 000012C8 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22060 000012CA 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22061 000012CC 06                      	push	es
 22062 000012CD 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22063                                  
 22064                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22065                                  
 22066 000012CE 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22067 000012D2 FC                      	cld
 22068 000012D3 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22069                                  
 22070 000012D5 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22071                                  
 22072                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22073                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22074                                  ;  cx = number of entries

 22833                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22834                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22835                                  
 22836                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22837                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22838                                  
 22839                                  new_init_loop:
 22840                                  
 22841                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22842                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22843                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22844                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22845                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22846                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22847                                  
 22848 00001471 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22849 00001474 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22850 00001476 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22851 0000147A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22852                                  
 22853 0000147D 1E                      	push	ds
 22854                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22855                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22856                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22857 0000147E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22858 00001481 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22859 00001483 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22860 00001486 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22861 00001488 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22862 0000148C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 22863 0000148F 1F                      	pop	ds
 22864                                  
 22865 00001490 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22866 00001493 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22867 00001497 C3                      	retn
 22868                                  
 22869                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 22878                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]

 23159                                  ;
 23160                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23161                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23162                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23163                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23164                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23165                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23166                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23167                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23168                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23169                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23170                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23171                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23172                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23173                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23174                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23175                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23176                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23177                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23178                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23179                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23180                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23181                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23182                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23183                                  ;	   :
 23184                                  ;
 23185                                  ;Note:
 23186                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23187                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23188                                  ;
 23189                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23190                                  ;
 23191                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23192                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23193                                  ;
 23194                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23195                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23196                                  ;
 23197                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23198                                  ;
 23199                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23200                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23201                                  ;
 23202                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23203                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23204                                  ;
 23205                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23206                                  ;
 23207                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23208                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23209                                  ;
 23210                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23211                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23212                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23213                                  ;
 23214                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23215                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23216                                  ;
 23217                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23218                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23219                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23220                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23221                                  
 23222                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23223                                  
 23224                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23225                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23226                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23227                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23228                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23229                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23230                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23231                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23232                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23233                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23234                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23235                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23236                                  
 23237                                  ;**** Function flags
 23238                                  
 23239                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23240                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23241                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23242                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23243                                  
 23244                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23245                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23246 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23247 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23248 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23249 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23250 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23251 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23252                                  endstruc
 23253                                  
 23254                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23255                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23256                                  ;
 23257                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23258                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23259                                  ;	     +-
 23260                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23261                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23262                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23263                                  ;	     |	:
 23264                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23265                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23266                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23267                                  ;	     |	:
 23268                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23269                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23270                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23271                                  ;	     +-	:
 23272                                  ;
 23273                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23274                                  ;
 23275                                  ;Note:
 23276                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23277                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23278                                  ;
 23279                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23280                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23281                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23282                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23283                                  
 23284                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23285                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23286                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23287                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23288                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23289                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23290                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23291                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23292                                  
 23293                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23294 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23295 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23296 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23297 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23298 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23299                                  endstruc
 23300                                  
 23301                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23302                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23303                                  ;
 23304                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23305                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23306                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23307                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23308                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23309                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23310                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23311                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23312                                  ;
 23313                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23314                                  ;
 23315                                  ;            +-
 23316                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23317                                  ;	    | or
 23318                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23319                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23320                                  ;	    | or
 23321                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23322                                  ;	    | or
 23323                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23324                                  ;	    | or
 23325                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23326                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23327                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23328                                  ;	    | or
 23329                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23330                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23331                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23332                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23333                                  ;	    +-
 23334                                  ;
 23335                                  ;
 23336                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23337                                  ;      list.
 23338                                  ;
 23339                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23340                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23341                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23342                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23343

 23348 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23349 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23350                                  endstruc

 23360                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 23361                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive

 23363                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 23364                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
