 23373                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 23374                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 23375                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 23376                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 23377                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 23378                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 23379                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23380                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23381                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23463                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 23465                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 23467                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23468                                  ; SysParse;
 23469                                  ;
 23470                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23471                                  ;
 23472                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23473                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23474                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23475                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23476                                  ;
 23477                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23478                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23479                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23480                                  ;
 23481                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23482                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23483                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23484                                  ;
 23485                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23486                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23487                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23488                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23489                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23490                                  ;
 23491                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23492                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23493                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23494                                  ;
 23495                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23496                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23497                                  ;
 23498                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23499                                  ;
 23500                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23501                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23502                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23503                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23504                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23505                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23506                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23507                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23508                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23509                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23510                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23511                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23512                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23513                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23514                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23515                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23516                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23517                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23518                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23519                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23520                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23521                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23522                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23523                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23524                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23525                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23526                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23527                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23528                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23529                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23530                                  
 23531                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23532                                  
 23533                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23534                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23535                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23536                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23537                                  
 23538                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23539                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23540                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23541                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23542                                  ;
 23543                                  
 23544                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23545                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23546                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23547                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23548                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23549                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23550                                  
 23551                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23552                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23553                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23554                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23555                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23556                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23557                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23558                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23559                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23560

 24164                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24165                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24166                                  ;
 24167                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24168                                  ;
 24169                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24170                                  ;	    AL = type
 24171                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24172                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24173                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24174                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24175                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24176                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24177                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24178                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24179                                  ;
 24180                                  ; Output:   None
 24181                                  ;
 24182                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24183                                  ;
 24184                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24185                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24186                                  
 24187                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24188 0000177B 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24189 0000177C 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 24190                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer
 24191 00001780 2E893E[C914]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DX],di		;AC034; set returned result address
 24192                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 24193                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 24194                                  	; 07/09/2023
 24195                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax
 24196 00001785 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax		; store type (al) and item tag (ah)
 24197                                  
 24198 00001788 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24199 00001789 2EA1[D814]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM] ;AC034; if yes,
 24200 0000178D 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 24201                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 24202 00001791 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24203                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 24204 00001792 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 24205 00001794 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 24206                                  
 24207                                  _$P_RLT02:				;AN000;
 24208 00001796 26895504                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val],dx ;AN000; then store 32bit

 24215

 24219

 24276                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24277                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 24278                                  ;
 24279                                  ; Function:  Check the match_flags and make the exit code and set the
 24280                                  ;	     result buffer
 24281                                  ;
 24282                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 24283                                  ;		Complex
 24284                                  ;		Date
 24285                                  ;		Time
 24286                                  ;		Drive
 24287                                  ;		Filespec
 24288                                  ;		Quoted String
 24289                                  ;		Simple String
 24290                                  ;
 24291                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24292                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24293                                  ;
 24294                                  ; Output:    None
 24295                                  ;
 24296                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format
 24297                                  ;	     _$P_Time_Format, _$P_Complex_Format, _$P_File_Foemat
 24298                                  ;	     _$P_Drive_Format
 24299                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24300                                  
 24301                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24302                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:19CFh)
 24303                                  
 24304                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24305                                  _$P_Check_Match_Flags:
 24306 000017FC 2EC606[6815]00          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_err_flag],_$P_NULL 
 24307                                  					;AN033;AC034;; clear filespec error flag.
 24308 00001802 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24309                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Match_Flag]

 24579                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24580                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24581                                  ;
 24582                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24583                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24584                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24585                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24586                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24587                                  ;
 24588                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24589                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24590                                  ;
 24591                                  ; Output:    None
 24592                                  ;
 24593                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24594                                  ;
 24595                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24596                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24597                                  
 24598                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24599                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24600                                  
 24601                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24602                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 24603                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24604 0000192A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24605 0000192B 2E800E[D114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24606 00001931 2E8026[D114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24607                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 24608 00001937 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24609 0000193A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24610 0000193C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24611                                  
 24612 0000193E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24613 00001940 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24614                                  
 24615 00001942 2E800E[D114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24616                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24617 00001948 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24618                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24619 00001949 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24620 0000194C 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24621 0000194D C3                      	retn
 24622                                  
 24623                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24624                                  
 24625                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24626                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 24627                                  
 24628                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24629                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 24630 0000194E 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24631 0000194F 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24632 00001950 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24633 00001951 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24634 00001952 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 24635 00001954 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 24636 00001956 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 24637                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 24638 00001957 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 24639 0000195A 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 24640 0000195C 743C                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 24641                                  
 24642 0000195E E8E000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 24643 00001961 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 24644                                  
 24645 00001963 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 24646 00001965 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 24647                                  
 24648                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24649                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 24650                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 24651                                  %if 0
 24652                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 24653                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24654                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24655                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24656                                  
 24657                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 24658                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 24659                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 24660                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24661                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24662                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24663                                  
 24664                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 24665                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24666                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24667                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24668                                  
 24669                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 24670                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 24671                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24672                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24673                                  
 24674                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 24675                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 24676                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24677                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24678                                  
 24679                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 24680                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24681                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 24682                                  %endif
 24683                                  ;****
 24684                                  %if 1
 24685                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24686                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2130h)
 24687                                  
 24688 00001967 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 24689 00001969 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; save binary number
 24690 0000196B E81C00                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 24691 0000196E 89D3                    	mov	bx,dx			; ax:bx = 2*(cx:dx)
 24692 00001970 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 24693 00001972 E81500                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow

 24883                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24884                                  ;
 24885                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24886                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24887                                  ;
 24888                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24889                                  ;
 24890                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24891                                  ;
 24892                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24893                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24894                                  
 24895                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24896                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24897 00001A2F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24898 00001A30 2EF606[D114]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24899 00001A36 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24900                                  
 24901 00001A38 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24902 00001A39 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24903                                  
 24904                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24905 00001A3A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24906 00001A3B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24907                                  
 24908 00001A3D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24909 00001A3E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24910                                  
 24911                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24912 00001A3F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24913 00001A40 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25457                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25458                                  	; cf=0
 25459                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25460                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 25461                                  
 25462                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_CY:			;AN000;
 25463 00001C35 F9                      	stc				;AN000; indicate EOL
 25464 00001C36 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25465

 25467 00001C38 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate non delim
 25468                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit:			;AN000; in this case, need
 25469 00001C39 4E                      	dec	si			;AN000;  backup index pointer
 25470                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25471                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25472                                  ;_$P_Exit_At_Extra:	 ; cf=0
 25473 00001C3A C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25474                                  
 25475                                  	; 12/12/2022

 25477                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate extra delim

 25480                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25481                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 25482                                  ;
 25483                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 25484                                  ;
 25485                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25486                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25487                                  ;
 25488                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 25489                                  ;**********************************************************************
 25490                                  
 25491                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 25492 00001C3B 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25493 00001C3C 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25494 00001C3D 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 25495 00001C3F 742C                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25496 00001C41 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 25497 00001C43 7428                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25498                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 25499 00001C45 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 25500 00001C47 7424                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25501                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 25502 00001C49 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 25503                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 25504 00001C4E 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25505 00001C50 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 25506 00001C52 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 25507                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25508 00001C56 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 25509                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25510 00001C59 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; *
 25511 00001C5B 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 25512 00001C5F 740B                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 25513                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25514                                  	;;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 25515                                  	;xor	ch,ch ; *
 25516 00001C61 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; 
 25517                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 25518 00001C64 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25519 00001C65 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 25520 00001C68 7403                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25521 00001C6A E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 25522                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25523                                  	; cx=0
 25524                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 25525                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 25526                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25527 00001C6C 41                      	inc	cx  ; zf=0  (cx=1) ; *
 25528                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 25529 00001C6D 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25530 00001C6E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25531 00001C6F C3                      	retn

 25533                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25534                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25535                                  ;
 25536                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25537                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25538                                  ;	    blanks.
 25539                                  ;
 25540                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25541                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25542                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25543                                  ;
 25544                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25545                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25546                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25547                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25548                                   
 25549                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25550                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 25551                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 25552                                  
 25553                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 25554 00001C70 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25555 00001C71 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25556 00001C72 2EC606[CB14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 25557                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 25558                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 25559 00001C78 2E8026[D114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 25560 00001C7E 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 25561 00001C80 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25562                                  
 25563 00001C82 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 25564 00001C84 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25565                                  
 25566 00001C86 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 25567 00001C88 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25568                                  
 25569                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 25570                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 25571                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25572                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 25573                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 25574                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 25575                                  %if 0
 25576                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25577                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 25578                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 25579                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25580                                  
 25581                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 25582                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25583                                  
 25584                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 25585                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 25586                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 25587                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25588                                  %endif
 25589                                  
 25590                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 25591 00001C8A 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 25592                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 25593 00001C8F 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25594                                  
 25595                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 25596 00001C91 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 25597                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 25598 00001C93 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 25599                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25600                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 25601                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 25602                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25603 00001C97 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 25604                                  
 25605 00001C99 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 25606                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 25607 00001C9C 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 25608 00001C9D 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 25609 00001CA0 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25610                                  
 25611 00001CA2 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 25612                                  
 25613                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 25614                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 25615                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25616                                  	; cx=0 here
 25617 00001CA4 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 25618                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 25619                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 25620 00001CA5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25621 00001CA6 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 25622 00001CA7 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25623                                  
 25624                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 25625 00001CA8 2EA2[CB14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 25626 00001CAC 2EF606[D114]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 25627 00001CB2 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 25628                                  
 25629 00001CB4 2E800E[D114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 25630                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 25631                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 25632 00001CBA 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 25633 00001CBC EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25634                                  
 25635                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25636                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25637                                  ;
 25638                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25639                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25640                                  ;
 25641                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25642                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25643                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25644                                  ;
 25645                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set) if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25646                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25647                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25648                                  
 25649                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25650                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25651                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25652                                  ;
 25653                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25654                                  
 25655                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25656                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25657                                  
 25658                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25659                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25660                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25661                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25662 00001CBE BD[DA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25663                                  
 25664                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25665 00001CC1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25666 00001CC3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25667                                  
 25668                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25669 00001CC5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25670 00001CC7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25671                                  
 25672 00001CC9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25673                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25674                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25675 00001CCA C3                      	retn
 25676                                  
 25677                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25678                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25679                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25680                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25681                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25682                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25683                                  
 25684                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25685                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25686 00001CCB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25687 00001CCD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25688                                  
 25689 00001CCF 2E800E[D114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25690                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25691                                  
 25692                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25693                                  	; cf=0
 25694                                  	;retn
 25695                                  
 25696                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25697                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25698                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25699 00001CD5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25700                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25701                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25702 00001CD6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25703                                  
 25704                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25705                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25706                                  ;
 25707                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25708                                  ;
 25709                                  ;  Input:
 25710                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25711                                  ;
 25712                                  ;  Output:
 25713                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25714                                  ;
 25715                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25716                                  ;
 25717                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25718                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25719                                  
 25720                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25721 00001CD7 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25722 00001CD8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25723 00001CD9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25724                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25725                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25726                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25727 00001CDA 2E8B36[CE14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 25728 00001CDF 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25729 00001CE1 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25730 00001CE3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25731 00001CE4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25732 00001CE5 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25733 00001CE6 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25734 00001CE7 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25735 00001CE8 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25736 00001CE9 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25737                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 25738                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25739 00001CEA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 25740 00001CEC B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25741 00001CEF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25742                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25743 00001CF1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25744 00001CF3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25745 00001CF5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25746 00001CF6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25747 00001CF7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25748 00001CF8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25749 00001CF9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25750 00001CFA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25751 00001CFB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25752 00001CFC 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25753                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25754 00001CFE 2E8936[CC14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25755 00001D03 2E891E[CE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25756                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25757                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25758                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25759                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25760 00001D08 2EC536[CC14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25761                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25762 00001D0D 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25763 00001D10 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25764 00001D12 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25765 00001D14 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25766 00001D16 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25767 00001D19 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25768 00001D1B F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25769 00001D1C EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25770                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25771 00001D1E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25772 00001D1F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25773                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25774 00001D20 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25775                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25776                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25777                                  	; cf=0
 25778                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25779                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25780 00001D22 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25781 00001D23 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25782 00001D24 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25783 00001D25 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25836                                  ;buf_parms p_parms <buf_parmsx>
 25837                                  buf_parms: 
 25838 00001D26 [2B1D]                  	dw	buf_parmsx
 25839 00001D28 01                      	db	1	; an extra delimiter list
 25840 00001D29 01                      	db	1	; length is 1
 25841 00001D2A 3B                      	db	';'	; delimiter
 25842                                  
 25843                                  buf_parmsx:
 25844 00001D2B 0102[351D][491D]        	dw	201h,buf_pos1,buf_pos2	; min 1, max 2 positionals
 25845 00001D31 01                      	db	1			; one switch
 25846 00001D32 [5D1D]                  	dw	sw_x_ctrl
 25847 00001D34 00                      	db	0			; no keywords
 25848                                  
 25849                                  ;buf_pos1 p_pos <8000h,0,result_val,buf_range_1>  ; numeric
 25850                                  buf_pos1:
 25851 00001D35 0080                    	dw	8000h	; numeric value??
 25852 00001D37 0000                    	dw	0	; function
 25853 00001D39 [6F1D]                  	dw	result_val ; result value buffer	
 25854 00001D3B [3E1D]                  	dw	buf_range_1 ; value list
 25855 00001D3D 00                      	db	0  	; no switches/keywords
 25856                                  
 25857                                  ;buf_range_1 p_range <,,,1,99>		; M050
 25858                                  buf_range_1:

 26350                                  
 26351                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26352                                  ;
 26353                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26354                                  ;
 26355                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26356                                  ;
 26357                                  ;   Modification log:
 26358                                  ;
 26359                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26360                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26361                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26362                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26363                                  ;
 26364                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26365                                  ;
 26366                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26367                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26368                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26369                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26370                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26371                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26372                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26373                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26374                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26375                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26376                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26377                                  ;
 26378                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26379                                  
 26380                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26381                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26382                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26383                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26384                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26385                                  
 26386                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26387                                  
 26388                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26389                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26390                                  
 26391                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26392                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26393                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26394                                  
 26395                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26396                                  ;
 26397                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26398                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26399                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 if the user has specified /S on the command-
 26400                                  ;	           line.
 26401                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26402                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26403                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26404                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26405                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26406                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26407                                  ;	          will be set to 1. All others will be set to 0.
 26408                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26409                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26410                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26411                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26412                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26413                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26414                                  ;	           for details).
 26415                                  
 26416 00001F25 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 26417 00001F26 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 26418 00001F27 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 26419 00001F29 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 26420 00001F2A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26421 00001F3A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26422 00001F5A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 26423 00001F5B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 26424 00001F5C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 26425                                  
 26426                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26427                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26428                                  
 26429                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26430                                  
 26431                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26432

 26442                                  
 26443 00001F5D 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded (paras)
 26444 00001F5F 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26445 00001F61 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26446 00001F63 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26447 00001F67 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26448                                  ; 30/12/2022
 26449                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26450 00001F6B 00                      ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 style) InitDevLoad?
 26451                                  ;
 26452 00001F6C 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 26453 00001F6D 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; current UMB used for loading devices (paras)
 26454 00001F6F 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26455 00001F71 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free mem blk in the current UMB (paras)
 26456                                  ;
 26457 00001F73 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 26458                                  ;
 26459 00001F77 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 26460 00001F79 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 26461                                  ;
 26462 00001F7B 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whether the current device
 26463                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 26464 00001F7C 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 26465                                  ;
 26466 00001F7E 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12h ?
 26467 00001F7F 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12h ram)
 26468 00001F81 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$' ; 3Com Device name
 26469                                  ;
 26470 00001F89 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 26471 00001F8A 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data
 26472 00001F8C 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 26473 00001F90 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 26474                                  				; to use the file name in the command line

 26536                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:

 26557                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26558                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26559                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26560                                  ;
 26561                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26562                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26563                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26564                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26565                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26566                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26567                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26568                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26569                                  ;
 26570 00001FD8 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26571 00001FD9 8916[B614]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 26572 00001FDD 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 26573                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG

 26610 00001FFD B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 26611 00001FFF 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 26612 00002001 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 26613 00002003 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end

 26615

 26617

 26619

 26621                                  
 26622                                  puteol:

 26624 0000200A AA                      	stosb
 26625 0000200B B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 26626 0000200D AA                      	stosb
 26627 0000200E 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved

 26679

 26683                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 26684 0000203A 07                      	pop	es			; es = [confbot] (CONFIG.SYS image seg)
 26685

 26709

 26711 0000205E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 26712                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26713                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26714 00002060 8826[BA14]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0

 26718 0000206A 7448                    	je	short blank_line	; then ignore this line.
 26719                                  
 26720                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26721                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 26722                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26723                                  ;%if 0
 26724                                  
 26725                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26726                                  
 26727                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26728                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26729                                  
 26730 0000206C A2[B814]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26731                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26732 0000206F 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26733                                  	
 26734                                  	; 08/09/2023
 26735 00002071 3826[B914]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 26736                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26737 00002075 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26738                                  
 26739 00002077 50                              push    ax                      ;
 26740 00002078 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26741 0000207B 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26742 0000207D E8AC21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26743 00002080 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26744 00002082 A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26745 00002085 58                              pop     ax
 26746                                  ;
 26747                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26748                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26749                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26750                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26751                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26752                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26753                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26754                                  ;   spot.
 26755                                  ;
 26756                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26757                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26758                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26759                                  ;   retrieved.
 26760                                  ;
 26761 00002086 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26762 0000208B 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 26763                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26764 0000208D F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26765 00002092 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26766 00002094 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26767 00002099 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 26768                                  final:                                  ;
 26769 0000209B 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26770                                  not_final:                              ;
 26771                                  ;endif
 26772                                  
 26773                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26774                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26775                                  
 26776 0000209E 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26777 000020A0 E88921                  	call	getchr
 26778 000020A3 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26779                                  
 26780 000020A5 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26781                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26782                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26783 000020AA 7380                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26784 000020AC E95408                  	jmp	badop
 26785                                  	
 26786                                  coff:	
 26787                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26788                                  	; ds = cs
 26789                                  	;push	cs

 26791 000020AF E87121                  	call	newline
