 35670 0000394F 51                              push    cx              ;
 35671 00003950 56                              push    si              ;
 35672 00003951 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 35673                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 35674 00003953 E83507                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 35675 00003956 724C                            jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 35676 00003958 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; '['
 35677 0000395A 7503                            jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 35678 0000395C 43                              inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 35679 0000395D EB40                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 35680                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 35681 0000395F 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 35682 00003961 750E                            jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 35683 00003963 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 35684 00003965 7538                            jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 35685 00003967 E8C0FF                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 35686 0000396A 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 35687 0000396F EB2E                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 35688                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 35689 00003971 3C31                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 35690 00003973 752A                            jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 35691                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 35692 00003975 E81307                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 35693                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 35694 00003978 3C0A                            cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 35695 0000397A 7423                            je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 35696 0000397C 3C2F                            cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 35697 0000397E 75F5                            jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 35698 00003980 E80807                          call    get_char        ;
 35699 00003983 24DF                            and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 35700 00003985 3A06[B91E]                      cmp     al,[swit_n+1]
 35701 00003989 7507                            jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 35702 0000398B 800E[FF46]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 35703 00003990 EBE3                            jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 35704                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 35705 00003992 3A06[C51E]                      cmp     al,[swit_f+1]
 35706 00003996 75E0                            jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 35707 00003998 800E[FF46]02                    or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 35708 0000399D EBD6                            jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 35709                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 35710 0000399F E8C306                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 35711 000039A2 EBAF                            jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 35712                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 35713 000039A4 5E                              pop     si              ;
 35714 000039A5 59                              pop     cx              ;
 35715                                  
 35716                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 35717                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 35718                                  
 35719 000039A6 F606[FF46]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 35720 000039AB 7508                            jnz	short menu_search
 35721                                  ;
 35722                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 35723                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 35724                                  ;
 35725 000039AD E8F2FE                          call    kbd_read
 35726 000039B0 7303                            jnc	short menu_search
 35727 000039B2 E9EE01                          jmp	menu_abort
 35728                                  
 35729                                  ;   Search for MENU block; it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 35730                                  
 35731                                  menu_search:
 35732 000039B5 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 35733 000039B7 BF[4447]                        mov     di,szMenu	;
 35734 000039BA E80304                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 35735 000039BD 7337                            jnc	short menu_found ;
 35736 000039BF C606[3C47]00                    mov     byte [szBoot],0
 35737 000039C4 E90C02                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 35738                                  
 35739                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 35740                                  
 35741                                  menu_color:
 35742 000039C7 51                      	push	cx              ;
 35743 000039C8 52                      	push	dx              ;
 35744                                  	;;mov	dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 35745                                  	; 10/09/2023
 35746                                  	;mov	dl,7 ; !*!
 35747 000039C9 E89E06                  	call	get_number	; get first number
 35748 000039CC 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh  ; !**!	; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 35749 000039CF 88DD                    	mov	ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 35750                                  	; 01/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization) by Erdogan Tan 
 35751                                  	; (high nibble of dl is 0)
 35752                                  	;and	dl,0F0h	; !*!	; (low nibble of dl would be zero)
 35753                                  	;or	dl,bl		; (low nibble of dl is 7) ! 14/08/2023
 35754 000039D1 88DA                    	mov	dl,bl	; 14/08/2023
 35755 000039D3 E83108                  	call	delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 35756 000039D6 750E                    	jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 35757 000039D8 E88F06                  	call	get_number	; get next number
 35758 000039DB 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 35759 000039DE 88DE                    	mov	dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 35760                                  	; 10/09/2023
 35761                                  	;and	dl,0Fh	; !**!	;
 35762 000039E0 B104                    	mov	cl,4            ;
 35763 000039E2 D2E3                    	shl	bl,cl           ;
 35764 000039E4 08DA                    	or	dl,bl           ;
 35765                                  check_color:
 35766 000039E6 38F5                    	cmp	ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 35767 000039E8 7503                    	jne	short set_color	; no
 35768 000039EA 80F208                  	xor	dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 35769                                  set_color:
 35770 000039ED 8816[FA46]              	mov	[bMenuColor],dl ;
 35771 000039F1 5A                      	pop	dx              ;
 35772 000039F2 59                      	pop	cx              ;
 35773 000039F3 E9A900                  	jmp	menu_nextitem
 35774                                  
 35775                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 35776                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 35777                                  
 35778                                  menu_found:
 35779 000039F6 C606[0447]01                    mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 35780                                          ;mov	word [offDefBlock],0
 35781 000039FB C606[0847]FF                    mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 35782 00003A00 8026[0347]FD                    and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 35783                                  	; 10/09/2023
 35784 00003A05 29D2                    	sub	dx,dx
 35785 00003A07 8916[0647]              	mov	[offDefBlock],dx ; 0
 35786                                  
 35787 00003A0B E85706                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 35788                                  	; 10/09/2023
 35789                                  	;sub	dx,dx		; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 35790                                  
 35791                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 35792                                  
 35793                                  menu_process:
 35794 00003A0E E87A06                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 35795 00003A11 722E                            jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 35796 00003A13 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 35797 00003A15 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 35798 00003A17 7428                            je	short to_menu_getdefault
 35799 00003A19 3C4F                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 35800 00003A1B 744D                            je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 35801 00003A1D 3C45                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 35802 00003A1F 7449                            je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 35803 00003A21 3C41                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 35804 00003A23 741E                            je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 35805 00003A25 3C52                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 35806 00003A27 749E                            je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 35807 00003A29 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 35808 00003A2B 740F                            je	short menu_numlock ;
 35809 00003A2D 3C30                            cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 35810 00003A2F 746E                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 35811 00003A31 E8C307                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 35812 00003A34 7469                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 35813 00003A36 F9                              stc                     ;
 35814 00003A37 E82607                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 35815 00003A3A EB63                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 35816                                  menu_numlock:
 35817 00003A3C E8EBFE                          call    set_numlock
 35818 00003A3F EB5E                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 35819                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 35820 00003A41 EB62                            jmp     short menu_getdefault
 35821                                  
 35822                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 35823                                  
 35824                                  menu_default:
 35825 00003A43 8936[0647]                      mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 35826 00003A47 803E[0947]00                    cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 35827 00003A4C 751A                            jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 35828 00003A4E E8EA05                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 35829 00003A51 724C                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 35830 00003A53 E8FB05                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 35831 00003A56 7247                            jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 35832 00003A58 89DE                            mov     si,bx           ;
 35833 00003A5A E80D06                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 35834 00003A5D 80FB5A                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 35835                                  	;jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 35836 00003A60 7602                            jna	short timeout_ok ; 01/08/2023
 35837 00003A62 B35A                    	mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 35838                                  timeout_ok:                     ;
 35839 00003A64 881E[0847]                      mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 35840                                  timeout_skip:
 35841 00003A68 EB35                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 35842                                  
 35843                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 35844                                  
 35845                                  menu_item:
 35846                                  	;cmp	dl,9	; 04/01/2023
 35847 00003A6A 80FA09                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 35848 00003A6D 7330                            jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 35849 00003A6F 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 35850 00003A71 E83303                          call    srch_block      ;
 35851 00003A74 7406                            je	short menu_itemfound ;
 35852 00003A76 F9                              stc                     ;
 35853 00003A77 E8E606                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 35854 00003A7A EB23                            jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 35855                                  
 35856                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 35857                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 35858                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 35859                                  
 35860                                  menu_itemfound:
 35861 00003A7C 42                              inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 35862 00003A7D 89D3                            mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 35863 00003A7F 8887[0A47]                      mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 35864 00003A83 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 35865                                  
 35866                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 35867                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 35868                                  ;   description...
 35869                                  
 35870 00003A85 89B7[1447]                      mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 35871 00003A89 89B7[2847]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 35872 00003A8D 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 35873 00003A8F E8A905                          call    skip_token      ;
 35874 00003A92 720B                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 35875 00003A94 E8BA05                          call    skip_delim      ;
 35876 00003A97 7206                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 35877 00003A99 87DF                            xchg    bx,di           ;
 35878 00003A9B 89BF[2847]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 35879                                  
 35880                                  menu_nextitem:
 35881 00003A9F E8C305                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 35882 00003AA2 E969FF                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 35883                                  
 35884                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 35885                                  
 35886                                  menu_getdefault:
 35887 00003AA5 08D2                            or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 35888 00003AA7 7505                            jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 35889 00003AA9 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 35890 00003AAB E9ED00                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 35891                                  menu_valid:
 35892 00003AAE 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ;
 35893 00003AB0 8816[0547]                      mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 35894 00003AB4 8B3E[0647]                      mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 35895 00003AB8 09FF                            or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 35896 00003ABA 741C                            jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 35897 00003ABC 43                              inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 35898                                  menu_chkdefault:
 35899 00003ABD 53                              push    bx              ;
 35900 00003ABE 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 35901 00003AC0 8BB7[1447]                      mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 35902 00003AC4 B98000                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 35903 00003AC7 1E                              push    ds              ;
 35904 00003AC8 06                              push    es              ;
 35905 00003AC9 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 35906 00003ACA E81A03                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 35907 00003ACD 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 35908 00003ACE 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 35909 00003ACF 7409                            je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 35910 00003AD1 43                              inc     bx              ;
 35911 00003AD2 3A1E[0547]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 35912 00003AD6 76E5                            jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 35913                                  menu_nodefault:
 35914 00003AD8 B301                            mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 35915                                  menu_setdefault:
 35916 00003ADA 881E[0447]                      mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 35917                                  
 35918                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 35919                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 35920                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 35921                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 35922                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 35923                                  ;   with no timeout)
 35924                                  
 35925 00003ADE 803E[0847]00                    cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 35926 00003AE3 750A                            jne	short menu_display ; no
 35927 00003AE5 F606[0347]01                    test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 35928 00003AEA 7503                            jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 35929 00003AEC E9C700                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 35930                                  
 35931                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 35932                                  
 35933                                  menu_display:
 35934 00003AEF B40F                            mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 35935 00003AF1 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 35936 00003AF3 B400                            mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 35937 00003AF5 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 35938 00003AF7 06                              push    es              ;
 35939 00003AF8 B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 35940 00003AFB 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 35941 00003AFD 26A14E00                        mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 35942 00003B01 A3[0147]                        mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 35943 00003B04 26A06200                        mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 35944 00003B08 A2[0047]                        mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 35945 00003B0B A1[FB46]                        mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 35946 00003B0E CD10                            int     10h             ;
 35947 00003B10 B80006                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 35948 00003B13 8A3E[FA46]                      mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 35949 00003B17 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 35950                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 35951 00003B19 268A164A00                      mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 35952 00003B1E FECA                    	dec     dl              ;
 35953                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 35954 00003B20 268A368400                      mov	dh,[es:84h]
 35955 00003B25 08F6                    	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 35956 00003B27 7504                            jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 35957 00003B29 8A36[FE46]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 35958                                  menu_clear:
 35959 00003B2D CD10                            int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 35960 00003B2F 07                              pop     es              ;
 35961 00003B30 8836[FE46]                      mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 35962 00003B34 BA[124C]                        mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 35963 00003B37 E89709                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 35964                                  
 35965 00003B3A F606[FF46]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 35966 00003B3F 751F                            jnz     short menu_nostatus
 35967 00003B41 8A3E[FB46]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 35968 00003B45 8A36[FE46]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 35969 00003B49 B200                            mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 35970 00003B4B B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 35971 00003B4D CD10                            int     10h             ;
 35972 00003B4F BA[604C]                        mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 35973 00003B52 E87C09                          call    print           ;
 35974 00003B55 B403                            mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 35975 00003B57 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 35976 00003B59 80EA02                          sub     dl,2            ;
 35977 00003B5C 8816[FD46]                      mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 35978                                  
 35979                                  menu_nostatus:
 35980 00003B60 BB0100                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 35981                                  menu_disploop:
 35982 00003B63 E8B002                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 35983 00003B66 43                              inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"? because it's a 1-byte opcode
 35984 00003B67 3A1E[0547]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 35985 00003B6B 76F6                            jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 35986                                  
 35987                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 35988                                  
 35989 00003B6D B200                            mov     dl,0            ; select column
 35990 00003B6F 88DE                            mov     dh,bl           ;
 35991 00003B71 80C604                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 35992 00003B74 8A3E[FB46]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 35993 00003B78 B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 35994 00003B7A CD10                            int     10h             ;
 35995                                  
 35996 00003B7C BA[4D4C]                        mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 35997 00003B7F E84F09                          call    print           ;
 35998 00003B82 E82903                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 35999 00003B85 BA[1E4A]                        mov     dx,crlfm	
 36000 00003B88 E84609                          call    print           ;
 36001 00003B8B FF36[FF46]                      push    word [bDisableUI]
 36002 00003B8F 800E[FF46]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 36003 00003B94 E86704                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 36004 00003B97 8F06[FF46]                      pop     word [bDisableUI]
 36005                                  
 36006                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 36007                                  
 36008                                  menu_autoselect:
 36009 00003B9B 83FBFF                          cmp     bx,-1 ; 0FFFFh	; clean boot requested?
 36010 00003B9E 7508                            jne	short normal_boot ; no
 36011 00003BA0 E8F105                          call    disable_autoexec; basically, add a /D to the command.com line
 36012                                  menu_abort:
 36013 00003BA3 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; then immediately exit with 0 config.sys image
 36014 00003BA5 E9E400                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 36015                                  
 36016                                  normal_boot:
 36017 00003BA8 83FBFE                          cmp     bx,-2 ; 0FFFEh	; back to top-level menu?
 36018 00003BAB 7509                            jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 36019 00003BAD 8B0E[5603]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 36020 00003BB1 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 36021 00003BB3 E9FFFD                          jmp     menu_search
 36022                                  
 36023                                  not_topmenu:
 36024 00003BB6 80BF[0A47]4F                    cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 36025 00003BBB 7510                            jne	short not_submenu
 36026 00003BBD 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 36027 00003BBF 8BBF[1447]                      mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 36028 00003BC3 E8E101                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 36029 00003BC6 89FE                            mov     si,di           ;
 36030 00003BC8 89D9                            mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 36031 00003BCA E929FE                          jmp     menu_found
 36032                                  
 36033                                  not_submenu:
 36034 00003BCD 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 36035 00003BCF 8B9F[1447]                      mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 36036                                  
 36037                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 36038                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 36039                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 36040                                  
 36041                                  no_selection:
 36042 00003BD3 891E[0647]                      mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 36043 00003BD7 8B0E[5603]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 36044 00003BDB 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 36045 00003BDD 1E                              push    ds              ;
 36046 00003BDE 8E1E[B614]                      mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 36047 00003BE2 29FF                            sub     di,di           ;
 36048                                  
 36049                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 36050                                  ;
 36051                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 36052                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 36053                                  ;   within the requested block. Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
 36054                                  ;   copied by copy_block in a recursive fashion; the amount of recursion is
 36055                                  ;   limited by the fact INCLUDE statements are REMed by copy_block as they are
 36056                                  ;   processed and by the number of unique INCLUDE stmts in config.sys...
 36057                                  ;
 36058                                  ;   BUGBUG 20-Mar-1992 JeffPar: If we can figure out the lower bound of the
 36059                                  ;   stack we're running on, then we should check it inside copy_block
 36060                                  
 36061                                  copyblock_loop:
 36062 00003BE4 53                              push    bx              ; save selected block name
 36063 00003BE5 E82F01                          call    copy_block      ; process (named or common) block
 36064 00003BE8 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 36065 00003BE9 7232                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 36066                                  
 36067                                  ;   copy_block can only return for two reasons: it hit eof or a new block
 36068                                  
 36069                                  copyblock_begin:
 36070                                  
 36071                                  ; 10/09/2023
 36072                                  %if 0
 36073                                          push    ax              ;
 36074                                          push    cx              ;
 36075                                          push    si              ;
 36076                                          push    di              ; always do "common" blocks
 36077                                          mov     di,szCommon
 36078                                          push    ds              ;
 36079                                          push    cs              ;
 36080                                          pop     ds              ;
 36081                                          call    comp_names      ;
 36082                                          pop     ds              ;
 36083                                          pop     di              ;
 36084                                          pop     si              ;
 36085                                          pop     cx              ;
 36086                                          pop     ax              ;
 36087                                          je	short copyblock_check
 36088                                  %endif
 36089                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36090 00003BEB 57                      	push	di
 36091 00003BEC BF[4947]                	mov	di,szCommon	; always do "common" blocks
 36092 00003BEF E81602                  	call	comp_names_x	; (comp_names_safe)
 36093 00003BF2 5F                      	pop	di
 36094 00003BF3 740F                    	je	short copyblock_check
 36095                                  
 36096 00003BF5 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; is there a block name to check?
 36097 00003BF7 7414                            jz	short copyblock_skip ; no
 36098 00003BF9 57                              push    di              ;
 36099 00003BFA 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; check block against given block name
 36100 00003BFC 1E                              push    ds              ;
 36101 00003BFD 06                              push    es              ;
 36102 00003BFE 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36103 00003BFF E8E501                          call    comp_names      ; is this the block we really want to do?
 36104 00003C02 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36105 00003C03 5F                              pop     di              ;
 36106                                  copyblock_check:
 36107 00003C04 7217                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 36108 00003C06 7505                            jne	short copyblock_skip ;
 36109 00003C08 E85A04                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 36110 00003C0B EBD7                            jmp	short copyblock_loop
 36111                                  
 36112                                  copyblock_skip:                 ;
 36113 00003C0D E85504                          call    skip_opt_line   ; this ain't the block we wanted, so skip it
 36114 00003C10 E87804                          call    get_char        ;
 36115 00003C13 7208                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 36116 00003C15 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 36117 00003C17 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 36118 00003C19 74D0                            je	short copyblock_begin
 36119 00003C1B EBF0                            jmp     short copyblock_skip ; anything else is just skipped
 36120                                  ;
 36121                                  ;   To create as little risk to the rest of SysInit as little as possible,
 36122                                  ;   and to free the workspace at "config_wrkseg" for creating an environment,
 36123                                  ;   copy the new config.sys image to "confbot"
 36124                                  ;
 36125                                  move_config:
 36126 00003C1D 89F9                            mov     cx,di           ; now copy workspace at DS:DI to "confbot"
 36127 00003C1F 51                              push    cx              ;
 36128                                  ;
 36129                                  ;   But first, copy the CONFIG=<configuration><0> string to the workspace,
 36130                                  ;   since the configuration name only currently exists in the "confbot" area
 36131                                  ;
 36132                                   	;mov	cx,7
 36133 00003C20 B90700                  	mov     cx,szMenu-szBoot-1
 36134 00003C23 BE[3C47]                        mov     si,szBoot	; first copy the CONFIG= part
 36135 00003C26 47                              inc     di              ; skip a byte, in case absolutely nothing
 36136                                                                  ; was copied to the workspace, because we always
 36137                                                                  ; zero the first byte of the workspace (below)
 36138                                  copy_boot: 
 36139                                  	;lods    byte ptr cs:[si];
 36140 00003C27 2E                              cs
 36141 00003C28 AC                      	lodsb
 36142 00003C29 8805                    	mov     [di],al         ;
 36143 00003C2B 47                              inc     di              ;
 36144 00003C2C E2F9                            loop    copy_boot       ;
 36145                                  
 36146 00003C2E 06                              push    es              ; then copy the configuration name
 36147                                          ;mov	cx,128-7	; put an upper limit on the name, to be safe
 36148                                  	; 04/01/2023
 36149 00003C2F B179                    	mov	cl,128-7
 36150 00003C31 2E8B36[0647]            	mov     si,[cs:offDefBlock]; ES:SI -> default block name
 36151 00003C36 09F6                            or      si,si           ; valid?
 36152 00003C38 7505                            jnz	short l1	; yes
 36153 00003C3A 0E                              push    cs              ;
 36154 00003C3B 07                              pop     es              ;
 36155 00003C3C BE[4947]                        mov     si,szCommon
 36156 00003C3F 268A04                  l1:     mov     al,[es:si]      ;
 36157 00003C42 E8B205                          call    any_delim       ;
 36158 00003C45 7406                            je	short l2	;
 36159 00003C47 8805                            mov     [di],al         ;
 36160 00003C49 46                              inc     si              ;
 36161 00003C4A 47                              inc     di              ;
 36162 00003C4B E2F2                            loop    l1              ;
 36163 00003C4D C6050A                  l2:     mov     byte [di],lf	; terminate the configuration string
 36164 00003C50 07                              pop     es              ;
 36165                                  
 36166                                  ;   Now we can copy "config_wrkseg" (DS) to "confbot" (ES)
 36167                                  
 36168 00003C51 29FF                            sub     di,di           ;
 36169 00003C53 2E893E[B414]                    mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 36170 00003C58 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 36171 00003C5A 59                              pop     cx              ; recover the size of "config_wrkseg"
 36172                                  
 36173 00003C5B 51                              push    cx              ;
 36174 00003C5C F3A4                            rep     movsb           ; moved!
 36175 00003C5E 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36176 00003C5F 8CD8                            mov     ax,ds           ;
 36177 00003C61 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36178                                  
 36179                                  ;   Now that the config_wrkseg is available once again, we shall
 36180                                  ;   use it to create an environment. The first thing to go in will be
 36181                                  ;   the "CONFIG=configuration" thing. It is also important to zero
 36182                                  ;   the first byte of the workspace, so that copy_envvar knows the buffer
 36183                                  ;   is empty.
 36184                                  
 36185 00003C62 06                              push    es              ;
 36186 00003C63 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ;
 36187 00003C65 46                              inc     si              ; ES:SI -> "CONFIG=configuration"
 36188 00003C66 26C606000000                    mov     byte [es:0],0	; empty the environment block
 36189 00003C6C E82600                          call    copy_envvar     ; copy envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 36190 00003C6F 07                              pop     es
 36191                                  
 36192                                  ;   Before returning, restore the default video page setting but do NOT
 36193                                  ;   do it using INT 10h's Set Active Page function, because if the menu was
 36194                                  ;   displayed on a different page, then it's because we don't want to see
 36195                                  ;   all the device driver/TSR goop (which goes to the default page)
 36196                                  
 36197                                  menu_done:
 36198 00003C70 803E[FB46]00                    cmp     byte [bMenuPage],0
 36199 00003C75 7415                            je	short menu_exit	;
 36200 00003C77 06                              push    es              ;
 36201 00003C78 B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ;
 36202 00003C7B 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ;
 36203 00003C7D A1[0147]                        mov     ax,[wCRTStart]  ;
 36204 00003C80 26A34E00                        mov     [es:004Eh],ax   ;
 36205 00003C84 A0[0047]                        mov     al,[bCRTPage]   ;
 36206 00003C87 26A26200                        mov     [es:0062h],al   ;
 36207 00003C8B 07                              pop     es              ;
 36208                                  menu_exit:
 36209 00003C8C 890E[5603]                      mov     [count],cx      ; set new counts
 36210 00003C90 890E[5803]                      mov     [org_count],cx  ;
 36211                                          ; 10/09/2023 (*)
 36212                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:46D3h
 36213                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:491Ah
 36214                                  	;sub	si,si           ; always return ES:SI pointing to config.sys
 36215 00003C94 C3                      	retn
 36216                                  
 36217                                  ; (*) NOTE: MSDOS 6.0 source code (SYSINIT2.ASM) contains 'sub si,si' at this
 36218                                  ;	position (then 'retn' just after it)
 36219                                  ;	but MSDOS 6.21 and PCDOS 7.1 SYSINITs contain only 'retn' here.
 36220                                  
 36221                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36222                                  ;
 36223                                  ;   copy_envvar: copy the envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 36224                                  ;
 36225                                  ;   INPUT
 36226                                  ;    ES:SI -> environment variable (in the form "var=string<cr/lf>")
 36227                                  ;
 36228                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36229                                  ;       config_envlen (ie, where to put next envvar) updated appropriately
 36230                                  ;       carry set if error (eg, missing =); clear otherwise
 36231                                  ;
 36232                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36233                                  ;       None
 36234                                  ;
 36235                                  ;   NOTES
 36236                                  ;       None
 36237                                  ;
 36238                                  ;   HISTORY
 36239                                  ;       Created 29-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36240                                  ;
 36241                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36242                                  
 36243                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36244                                  	; (SYSINIT:46D4h)
 36245                                  
 36246                                  copy_envvar:
 36247 00003C95 51                              push    cx              ;
 36248 00003C96 56                              push    si              ;
 36249 00003C97 1E                              push    ds              ;
 36250 00003C98 06                              push    es              ;
 36251 00003C99 06                              push    es              ;
 36252 00003C9A 8E06[B614]                      mov     es,[config_wrkseg] ; ES:DI to point to next available byte
 36253 00003C9E 1F                              pop     ds                 ; DS:SI to point to envvar
 36254                                  
 36255                                  ;   Have to calculate the length of the variable name (and if we hit
 36256                                  ;   the end of the line before we hit '=', then it's curtains for this
 36257                                  ;   config.sys line)
 36258                                  ;
 36259                                  ;   The check for NULL is important because copy_envvar is also used to copy
 36260                                  ;   the initial CONFIG= setting, which will have been zapped by a NULL if no
 36261                                  ;   menu block existed (in order to prevent the creation of an environment)
 36262                                  
 36263 00003C9F 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ;
 36264                                  copy_varlen:                    ;
 36265 00003CA1 AC                              lodsb                   ;
 36266 00003CA2 08C0                            or      al,al           ; NULL?
 36267                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 36268 00003CA4 746B                            jz	short copy_envexit ; yes, abort
 36269 00003CA6 3C0D                            cmp     al,cr           ;
 36270                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 36271 00003CA8 7467                            je	short copy_envexit
 36272 00003CAA 3C0A                            cmp     al,lf           ;
 36273                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 36274 00003CAC 7463                            je	short copy_envexit
 36275 00003CAE 41                              inc     cx              ;
 36276 00003CAF 3C3D                            cmp     al,'='          ;
 36277 00003CB1 75EE                            jne	short copy_varlen
 36278 00003CB3 B000                            mov     al,0            ;
 36279 00003CB5 8A24                            mov     ah,[si]         ; save char after '='
 36280 00003CB7 29CE                            sub     si,cx           ; back up to given varname
 36281 00003CB9 49                              dec     cx              ; CX == # of bytes in varname
 36282 00003CBA 29FF                            sub     di,di           ; start looking for DS:SI at ES:0
 36283                                  copy_varsrch:
 36284 00003CBC 263805                          cmp     byte [es:di],al
 36285 00003CBF 7425                            je	short copy_envprep ; search failed, just copy var
 36286 00003CC1 89FB                            mov     bx,di           ; ES:BX -> start of this varname
 36287 00003CC3 51                              push    cx              ;
 36288 00003CC4 56                              push    si              ;
 36289 00003CC5 F3A6                            repe    cmpsb           ;
 36290 00003CC7 5E                              pop     si              ;
 36291 00003CC8 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36292 00003CC9 7531                            jne	short copy_varnext ; no match, skip to next varname
 36293 00003CCB 26803D3D                        cmp     byte [es:di],'='
 36294 00003CCF 752B                            jne     short copy_varnext ; no match, there's more characters
 36295                                  
 36296                                  ;   Previous occurrence of variable has been found; determine the
 36297                                  ;   entire length and then destroy it
 36298                                  
 36299 00003CD1 B9FFFF                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 36300 00003CD4 F2AE                            repne   scasb           ; guaranteed to get null (since we put it there)
 36301 00003CD6 56                              push    si              ;
 36302 00003CD7 89FE                            mov     si,di           ;
 36303 00003CD9 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ;
 36304 00003CDB 2E8B0E[B414]                    mov     cx,[cs:config_envlen]
 36305 00003CE0 29F1                            sub     cx,si           ; destroy variable now
 36306                                  	;rep movs byte ptr es:[di],byte ptr es:[si]
 36307                                  	;;db 0F3h,26h,0A4h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4724h
 36308                                  
 36309 00003CE2 F3                      	rep	; 0F3h
 36310 00003CE3 26                      	es	; 26h
 36311 00003CE4 A4                      	movsb	; 0A4h
 36312                                  
 36313 00003CE5 5E                      	pop     si
 36314                                  copy_envprep:
 36315 00003CE6 80FC0D                          cmp     ah,cr          ; if there is nothing after the '='
 36316 00003CE9 741D                            je	short copy_envdel ; then just exit with variable deleted
 36317 00003CEB 80FC0A                          cmp     ah,lf           ;
 36318 00003CEE 7418                            je	short copy_envdel
 36319                                          ;jmp	short copy_envloop
 36320                                  	; 04/01/2023
 36321                                  copy_envloop:                  ;
 36322 00003CF0 AC                      	lodsb                   ;
 36323 00003CF1 3C0D                    	cmp	al,cr           ;
 36324 00003CF3 7410                    	je	short copy_envdone
 36325 00003CF5 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf           ;
 36326 00003CF7 740C                    	je	short copy_envdone
 36327 00003CF9 AA                      	stosb                   ;
 36328 00003CFA EBF4                    	jmp	short copy_envloop
 36329                                  
 36330                                  copy_varnext:                   ;
 36331 00003CFC 51                              push    cx              ;
 36332 00003CFD B9FFFF                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 36333 00003D00 F2AE                            repne   scasb           ;
 36334 00003D02 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36335 00003D03 EBB7                            jmp	short copy_varsrch
 36336                                  
 36337                                  	; 04/01/2023
 36338                                  ;copy_envloop:                  ;
 36339                                  ;	lodsb                   ;
 36340                                  ;	cmp	al,cr           ;
 36341                                  ;	je	short copy_envdone
 36342                                  ;	cmp	al,lf           ;
 36343                                  ;	je	short copy_envdone
 36344                                  ;	stosb                   ;
 36345                                  ;	jmp	short copy_envloop
 36346                                  
 36347                                  copy_envdone:                   ;
 36348 00003D05 28C0                            sub     al,al           ; do SUB to clear carry as well
 36349 00003D07 AA                              stosb                   ; always null-terminate these puppies
 36350                                  copy_envdel:                    ;
 36351 00003D08 268805                          mov     [es:di],al      ; and stick another null to terminate the env.
 36352 00003D0B 2E893E[B414]                    mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 36353                                  	; 10/09/2023 (x) - Erdogan Tan
 36354 00003D10 F9                      	stc ; in order to clear carry flag via cmc (compact code trick!)
 36355                                  copy_envexit:                   ;
 36356 00003D11 F5                      	cmc ; (x) ; reverse carry flag status (je -> cf=1)
 36357 00003D12 07                              pop     es              ;
 36358 00003D13 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36359 00003D14 5E                              pop     si              ;
 36360 00003D15 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36361                                  
 36362                                  copy_done:	; 18/12/2022
 36363 00003D16 C3                              retn
 36364                                  
 36365                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36366                                  ;
 36367                                  ;   copy_block: copy the current block to the new config.sys workspace
 36368                                  ;
 36369                                  ;   INPUT
 36370                                  ;       CX == remaining bytes in "organized" config.sys memory image
 36371                                  ;    ES:SI -> remaining bytes in "organized" config.sys memory image
 36372                                  ;    DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace (equal in size to the original
 36373                                  ;             config.sys image) where the current block is to be copied
 36374                                  ;
 36375                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36376                                  ;       Same as above
 36377                                  ;       AL also equals the last character read from the organized image
 36378                                  ;
 36379                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36380                                  ;       All
 36381                                  ;
 36382                                  ;   NOTES
 36383                                  ;       None
 36384                                  ;
 36385                                  ;   HISTORY
 36386                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36387                                  ;
 36388                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36389                                  
 36390                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36391                                  	; (SYSINIT:4759h)
 36392                                  
 36393                                  copy_block:
 36394 00003D17 E87103                          call    get_char        ; check for include
 36395 00003D1A 72FA                            jc	short copy_done	;
 36396 00003D1C 247F                    	and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 36397 00003D1E 3C5B                    	cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; another BEGIN implies END as well
 36398 00003D20 74F4                            je	short copy_done ;
 36399                                  
 36400 00003D22 3C4A                            cmp     al,CONFIG_INCLUDE ; 'J'
 36401 00003D24 88E0                            mov     al,ah           ; AL == the original line code
 36402 00003D26 753A                            jne	short copy_line	; not an "include" line
 36403                                  
 36404                                  ;   We have hit an "INCLUDE" line; first, REM out the line so that we
 36405                                  ;   never try to include the block again (no infinite include loops please),
 36406                                  ;   then search for the named block and call copy_block again.
 36407                                  
 36408 00003D28 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM ; '0'
 36409 00003D2D 57                              push    di              ;
 36410                                  
 36411 00003D2E BF[4447]                        mov     di,szMenu
 36412 00003D31 E8D400                          call    comp_names_safe ; don't allow INCLUDE MENU
 36413 00003D34 7426                            je	short copy_skip	;
 36414                                  
 36415 00003D36 BF[4947]                        mov     di,szCommon
 36416 00003D39 E8CC00                          call    comp_names_safe ; don't allow INCLUDE COMMON
 36417 00003D3C 741E                            je	short copy_skip	;
 36418                                  
 36419 00003D3E 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; try to find the block
 36420 00003D40 E86400                          call    srch_block      ;
 36421 00003D43 89FA                            mov     dx,di           ;
 36422                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36423                                  	;pop    di              ;
 36424 00003D45 7514                            jne	short copy_error ; no such block
 36425 00003D47 5F                      	pop	di  ; 10/09/2023
 36426 00003D48 51                              push    cx              ;
 36427 00003D49 89D9                            mov     cx,bx           ;
 36428 00003D4B 56                              push    si              ;
 36429 00003D4C 4A                              dec     dx              ;
 36430 00003D4D 89D6                            mov     si,dx           ;
 36431 00003D4F E80E03                          call    skip_line       ; skip the rest of the "block name" line
 36432 00003D52 E8C2FF                          call    copy_block      ; and copy in the rest of that block
 36433 00003D55 5E                              pop     si              ;
 36434 00003D56 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36435 00003D57 28C0                            sub     al,al           ; force skip_opt_line to skip...
 36436 00003D59 EB2B                            jmp     short copy_nextline
 36437                                  
 36438                                  copy_error:
 36439                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36440 00003D5B F8                      	clc
 36441                                  copy_skip:
 36442 00003D5C 5F                              pop     di
 36443                                  ;copy_error:
 36444                                  	; 10/09/2023 (cf=0)
 36445                                  	;clc                    ;
 36446 00003D5D E80004                          call    print_error     ; note that carry is clear, no pause
 36447 00003D60 EB24                            jmp     short copy_nextline
 36448                                  
 36449                                  ;   Copy the line at ES:SI to the current location at DS:DI
 36450                                  
 36451                                  copy_line:
 36452 00003D62 8805                            mov     [di],al         ;
 36453 00003D64 47                              inc     di              ;
 36454 00003D65 3C20                            cmp     al,' '          ; is this is a "real" line with a "real" code?
 36455 00003D67 721D                            jb	short copy_nextline ; no
 36456 00003D69 2E803E[B914]00                  cmp     byte [cs:config_multi],0
 36457 00003D6F 7409                            je	short copy_loop	; not a multi-config config.sys, don't embed #s
 36458 00003D71 E81700                          call    get_linenum	; BX == line # of line @ES:SI
 36459 00003D74 891D                            mov     [di],bx         ; stash it immediately following the line code
 36460 00003D76 47                              inc     di              ;
 36461 00003D77 47                              inc     di              ;
 36462 00003D78 EB08                            jmp     short copy_next ;
 36463                                  copy_loop:                      ;
 36464 00003D7A E80E03                          call    get_char        ;
 36465 00003D7D 7297                            jc	short copy_done ; end of file
 36466 00003D7F 8805                            mov     [di],al         ;
 36467 00003D81 47                              inc     di              ;
 36468                                  copy_next:
 36469 00003D82 3C0A                            cmp     al,lf ; 0Ah	; done with line?
 36470 00003D84 75F4                            jne	short copy_loop	; nope
 36471                                  
 36472                                  copy_nextline:
 36473 00003D86 E8DC02                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 36474 00003D89 EB8C                            jmp     short copy_block
 36475                                  
 36476                                  	; 18/12/2022
 36477                                  ;copy_done:
 36478                                          ;retn
 36479                                  
 36480                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36481                                  ;
 36482                                  ;   get_linenum: return line # (in BX) of current line (@ES:SI)
 36483                                  ;
 36484                                  ;   INPUT
 36485                                  ;    ES:SI -> some line in the config.sys memory image
 36486                                  ;
 36487                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36488                                  ;       BX == line # (relative to 1)
 36489                                  ;
 36490                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36491                                  ;       DX
 36492                                  ;
 36493                                  ;   NOTES
 36494                                  ;       None
 36495                                  ;
 36496                                  ;   HISTORY
 36497                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36498                                  ;
 36499                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36500                                  
 36501                                  get_linenum:
 36502 00003D8B 50                              push    ax              ;
 36503 00003D8C 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; BX == line # (to be returned)
 36504 00003D8E 51                              push    cx              ;
 36505 00003D8F 89F2                            mov     dx,si           ; DX == the offset we're looking for
 36506 00003D91 56                              push    si              ;
 36507 00003D92 2E8B0E[5603]                    mov     cx,[cs:count]   ;
 36508 00003D97 29F6                            sub     si,si           ; prepare to scan entire file
 36509                                  get_linenum_loop:               ;
 36510 00003D99 E8C402                          call    skip_line       ;
 36511 00003D9C 7205                            jc	short get_linenum_done
 36512 00003D9E 43                              inc     bx              ;
 36513 00003D9F 39D6                            cmp     si,dx           ; have we exceeded the desired offset yet?
 36514 00003DA1 72F6                            jb	short get_linenum_loop ; no
 36515                                  get_linenum_done:               ;
 36516 00003DA3 5E                              pop     si              ;
 36517 00003DA4 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36518 00003DA5 58                              pop     ax              ;
 36519 00003DA6 C3                              retn
 36520                                  
 36521                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36522                                  ;
 36523                                  ;   srch_block: searches entire config.sys for block name @ES:DI
 36524                                  ;
 36525                                  ;   INPUT
 36526                                  ;       ES -> config.sys image
 36527                                  ;    ES:DI -> block name to find
 36528                                  ;
 36529                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36530                                  ;       ZF flag set, if found
 36531                                  ;    ES:DI -> just past the name in the block heading, if found
 36532                                  ;       BX == # bytes remaining from that point, if found
 36533                                  ;
 36534                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36535                                  ;       None
 36536                                  ;
 36537                                  ;   NOTES
 36538                                  ;       This differs from "find_block" in that it searches the ENTIRE
 36539                                  ;       config.sys image, not merely the remaining portion, and that it
 36540                                  ;       takes a pointer to block name that is *elsewhere* in the image
 36541                                  ;       (ie, ES) as opposed to some string constant in our own segment (DS).
 36542                                  ;
 36543                                  ;   HISTORY
 36544                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36545                                  ;
 36546                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36547                                  
 36548                                  srch_block:	          ; returns BX -> named block in CONFIG.SYS
 36549 00003DA7 50                              push    ax              ;
 36550 00003DA8 51                              push    cx              ;
 36551 00003DA9 2E8B0E[5603]                    mov     cx,[cs:count]   ;
 36552 00003DAE 56                              push    si              ;
 36553 00003DAF 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 36554 00003DB1 1E                              push    ds              ;
 36555 00003DB2 06                              push    es              ;
 36556 00003DB3 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36557 00003DB4 E80900                          call    find_block      ;
 36558 00003DB7 89F7                            mov     di,si           ;
 36559 00003DB9 89CB                            mov     bx,cx           ;
 36560 00003DBB 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36561 00003DBC 5E                              pop     si              ;
 36562 00003DBD 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36563 00003DBE 58                              pop     ax              ;
 36564                                  find_exit: ; 16/04/2019
 36565 00003DBF C3                              retn			;
 36566                                  
 36567                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36568                                  ;
 36569                                  ;   find_block: searches rest of config.sys for block name @DS:DI
 36570                                  ;
 36571                                  ;   INPUT
 36572                                  ;    DS:DI -> block name to find
 36573                                  ;    ES:SI -> remainder of config.sys image
 36574                                  ;       CX == remaining size of config.sys image
 36575                                  ;
 36576                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36577                                  ;       ZF flag set, if found (also, CF set if EOF)
 36578                                  ;    ES:SI -> where the search stopped (at end of block name or EOF)
 36579                                  ;       CX == # bytes remaining from that point
 36580                                  ;
 36581                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36582                                  ;       AX
 36583                                  ;
 36584                                  ;   NOTES
 36585                                  ;       This differs from "srch_block" in that it searches only the
 36586                                  ;       remaining portion of the config.sys image and leaves SI and CX
 36587                                  ;       pointing to where the search left off, and that it takes a pointer
 36588                                  ;       to search string in our own segment (DS:DI instead of ES:DI).
 36589                                  ;
 36590                                  ;   HISTORY
 36591                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36592                                  ;
 36593                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36594                                  
 36595                                  find_block:
 36596 00003DC0 E8C802                          call    get_char        ; get line code
 36597 00003DC3 72FA                            jc	short find_exit	; end of file
 36598 00003DC5 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 36599 00003DC7 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; beginning of a block?
 36600 00003DC9 740C                            je	short check_line ; no
 36601 00003DCB 3C4A                            cmp     al,CONFIG_INCLUDE
 36602 00003DCD 7513                            jne	short next_line	;
 36603 00003DCF 2E800E[B914]01                  or	byte [cs:config_multi],1
 36604 00003DD5 EB0B                            jmp     short next_line ;
 36605                                  check_line:
 36606 00003DD7 2E800E[B914]01                  or      byte [cs:config_multi],1
 36607 00003DDD E80700                          call    comp_names      ; compare block names
 36608 00003DE0 76DD                            jbe	short find_exit	; end of file, or names matched
 36609                                  next_line:
 36610 00003DE2 E88002                          call    skip_opt_line   ; no, so skip to next line
 36611 00003DE5 EBD9                            jmp	short find_block  ;
 36612                                  ;find_exit:
 36613                                  ;	retn
 36614                                  
 36615                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36616                                  ;
 36617                                  ;   comp_names: compares keyword @DS:DI to position in config.sys @ES:SI
 36618                                  ;
 36619                                  ;   INPUT
 36620                                  ;    DS:DI -> keyword to compare
 36621                                  ;    ES:SI -> position in config.sys
 36622                                  ;       CX == remaining bytes in config.sys
 36623                                  ;
 36624                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36625                                  ;       ZF flag set, if match (also, CF set if EOF)
 36626                                  ;    ES:SI -> where the comparison stopped (at end of block name or EOF)
 36627                                  ;       CX == # bytes remaining from that point
 36628                                  ;
 36629                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36630                                  ;       AX
 36631                                  ;
 36632                                  ;   NOTES
 36633                                  ;       None
 36634                                  ;
 36635                                  ;   HISTORY
 36636                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36637                                  ;
 36638                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36639                                  
 36640                                  comp_names:
 36641 00003DE7 57                              push    di              ;
 36642                                  comp_loop:                      ;
 36643 00003DE8 E8A002                          call    get_char        ;
 36644 00003DEB 7210                            jc	short comp_exit	;
 36645 00003DED E80704                          call    any_delim       ; is next character a delimiter?
 36646 00003DF0 8A25                            mov     ah,[di]         ; (get next character we're supposed to match)
 36647 00003DF2 740B                            je	short comp_almost ; yes, it *could* be a match
 36648 00003DF4 47                              inc     di              ;
 36649 00003DF5 25DFDF                          and     ax,~2020h ; 0DFDFh 
 36650                                  				; BUGBUG -- assumes both names are alphanumeric -JTP
 36651 00003DF8 38E0                            cmp     al,ah           ; match?
 36652 00003DFA 74EC                            je	short comp_loop ; yes, keep looking at the characters
 36653 00003DFC F8                              clc                     ; prevent erroneous eof indication: clear carry
 36654                                  comp_exit:                      ;
 36655 00003DFD 5F                              pop     di              ;
 36656 00003DFE C3                              retn			;
 36657                                  comp_almost:                    ;
 36658 00003DFF 86C4                            xchg    al,ah           ; we don't know for sure if it's a match
 36659 00003E01 E8F303                          call    any_delim       ; until we verify that the second string has
 36660 00003E04 86C4                            xchg    al,ah           ; been exhausted also...
 36661 00003E06 EBF5                            jmp     short comp_exit ; if we are, this call to any_delim will tell...
 36662                                  
 36663                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36664                                  
 36665                                  	; 10/09/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 36666                                  comp_names_x:
 36667                                  	;
 36668                                  comp_names_safe:
 36669 00003E08 50                              push    ax
 36670 00003E09 51                              push    cx
 36671 00003E0A 56                              push	si
 36672 00003E0B 1E                              push    ds
 36673 00003E0C 0E                              push    cs
 36674 00003E0D 1F                              pop     ds
 36675 00003E0E E8D6FF                          call    comp_names
 36676 00003E11 1F                              pop     ds
 36677 00003E12 5E                      	pop	si
 36678 00003E13 59                              pop     cx
 36679 00003E14 58                              pop     ax
 36680 00003E15 C3                              retn
 36681                                  
 36682                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36683                                  ;
 36684                                  ;   print_item: display menu item #BL
 36685                                  ;
 36686                                  ;   INPUT
 36687                                  ;       BL == menu item # to display
 36688                                  ;
 36689                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36690                                  ;       Menu item displayed, with appropriate highlighting if BL == bDefBlock
 36691                                  ;
 36692                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36693                                  ;       None
 36694                                  ;
 36695                                  ;   NOTES
 36696                                  ;       This function saves/restores the current cursor position, so you
 36697                                  ;       needn't worry about it.
 36698                                  ;
 36699                                  ;   HISTORY
 36700                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36701                                  ;
 36702                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36703                                  
 36704                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36705                                  	; (SYSINIT:485Ah)
 36706                                  
 36707                                  print_item:		; prints menu item #BL (1 to N)
 36708 00003E16 50                              push    ax              ;
 36709 00003E17 53                              push    bx              ;
 36710 00003E18 51                              push    cx              ;
 36711 00003E19 52                              push    dx              ;
 36712 00003E1A 56                              push    si              ;
 36713 00003E1B B403                            mov     ah,03h          ; get cursor position
 36714 00003E1D 8A3E[FB46]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ; always page zero
 36715 00003E21 CD10                            int     10h             ; DH/DL = row/column
 36716 00003E23 52                              push    dx              ; save it
